159744.name: The Goblin Cave
159744.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you remember when you were 13 and how the world seemed a simpler yet more wondrous place? Here is the first offering by a new player who wanted to take the reigns and do something more interesting than his classmates for an English project.

If you think the odd saving roll is too demanding, take the advice of the legendary Mad Roy Cram and cheat egregiously!

159745.name: Spielwelt (Issue 23 - Apr 1985)
rpgpublisher: Club für Fantasy- und Simulationsspiele e.V.
159745.description: This issue contains news, reader survey results, results of the Scenario of the Year 1984 voting, reviews, articles, and a fantasy scenario with stats for several systems.

159746.name: City Ruins
159746.description:
From the Introduction

Once a prosperous city must have stood in this place. Today though all that remains are ruins. Parts of the foundation walls, archways, a few empty and broken window frames, the occasional wooden beam as well as piles of stone and fragments of plaster are all that remains. Their arrangement suggests that this must once have been the backyard of a residential area with a well at its center. The ruins leave few hints, if any, at the fate of the city and its citizens. The absence of soot, charred wood and heat cracked stone at least suggests that it was no fire that eradicated the city from the landscape.

159747.name: Das Schuldenkarussell
159747.description:
Objective: ballance your income/your expenses; learn mechanism of insolvency
- acting by turns -
roll the die: each player moves forward according number on a circle; ending on a marked space draw appropiate card and follow instructions. Players are at the mercy of luck - but can protect themselves by spending their money carefully, underwriting riscs, ... Game ends after agreed time or completed circles.

note:
produced by F.X. Schmid; playing time strongly dependend on no. of participants; suitable for school classes.

159748.name: Savannah Village
159748.description:
From the Introduction

The rain showers of the rainy season have barely passed and luscious green grass has sprung up where there was only dusty barren ground mere days ago. One might even be tempted to think that this small village is surrounded by fertile lands. The few dead trees among and around the huts still give testament to the long droughts that have struck the land over the past few years.

The huts of the village themselves are simple affairs. Their foundations and a few pillars carrying the roof are made from stone. The walls on the other hand are simple wickerwork and the roofs are thatched with the dried grass of past years. At the center of each hut there is a fireplace and a large hole in the roof to allow the smoke to escape.

159749.name: City Wall
159749.description:
From the Introduction

Many years ago, when it was erected, this wall was a formidable defense that kept the city behind it save from many attacks. These days, while still impressive, it has been surpassed by other fortifications. The wall is not nearly high enough to fend of determined attackers these days if they have at least rudimentary knowledge of siege tactics. As building a new wall would be a serious drain on the cities coffers the council has decided on another course of action. Instead of an expensive new wall they deepened and widened the moat at the wall's base. In another way the wall serves as well today as it did when it was completed. It keeps the population inside under control and channels traffic through the few gates where it can be taxed.

159750.name: Dark Altar
159750.description:
From the Introduction

The temple has crumbled almost into nothingness. Even the plaster of the ground is in shambles. Some kind of vile reddish black liquid is oozing out of the cracked ground, clinging unpleasantly to everything coming in touch with it. Yet at the center of all this corruption and decay stands the evil, jagged altar, that once was the heart of the innermost insanctum of the temple that rose here. And as if to spite all the destruction around it, it stands almost untouched by years and many an attempt to remove or destroy it. Freshly lit torches and iron cages partially sunk into the vile black liquid suggest that once again someone is trying to make use of this unholy place.

159751.name: Houses of Sheoloth
159751.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can tread the fabled halls of the dark elf nobility and learn what makes them function, what religions they follow and what kind of power they wield in the treacherous depths below the sunlit lands.

The life of nobility in the dark elven houses is fraught with danger and players can use the rules from Sheoloth: The Sprawling City to create dark elf characters, then join the myriad of houses that vie for power in the Game of Bones and its clandestine Sheathed War. Games Masters will find faction rules for every house in this book, and suggested write-ups for the minor participants in dark elven society.

Presented in this tome is a wealth of information on these houses, the more minor players and the Game of Bones, the ages old system of competition and clandestine warfare fought by the dark elves.

Players and Game Masters alike can use this book to expand their campaign worlds and characters, present new options for players who like to vie for power and add even more flavour to a dark elf-centric campaign.

So send out your assassins, take your place in the shadows and prepare to confront dark elf nobility as you enter their houses, and take part in the ruthless Game of Bones.

159752.name: Portal Platform
159752.description:
From the Introduction

A small quadratic platform seems to be afloat amidst nothingness. The only thing else to be seen is a swirling disc of star like motes rotating below the platform that might just be related to slight tremble going through the floor tiles every once in a while. At the center of the platform stands a curious contraption of rusty iron and shiny brass. It is crowned by a large ruby, or at least a large gem that looks like a ruby, held aloft by three brass levers. Maybe this contraption is somehow related to the four portals around the platforms circumference. Three of the portals are filled with glowing swirling mist not entirely unlike the vortex below the platform. One glows in a green, one in a reddish and another in a yellow hue. The last portal though is filled by some kind of black mist that seems to swallow all light touching it.

159753.name: Rivership
159753.description:
From the Introduction

The small channel, connecting two rivers, lies tranquil embedded in the landscape. Long grass and fruit bearing trees grow on its sandy flanks. A small riverboat slowly makes its way along this artificial waterway. Originally built for smaller sailing ships and boats towed by ox or horse teams it is barely deep enough for the steamship. Only its very center is deep enough for the small freight which, fully loaded, lies deep in the water. The plume of its coal powered steam engine gives away its presence far and wide.

159754.name: Dragon's Hoard
159754.description:
From the Introduction

A large chamber sits at this intersection of two equally sizable corridors. In each wall gapes a massive circular portal leading deeper into the dungeon. At the center of the chamber, bathed into flickering orange light by a few torches along the walls, rest numerous piles of glittering gold coins. Some of them apparently piled head high. Upon coming closer one might realize that these treasure piles almost completely fill a more than knee deep depression in the floor as well. And a very careful observer might even realize that it looks like something tends to move along these riches on a regular basis.

159755.name: Mountaintop Oracle
159755.description:
From the Introduction

After a hard climb up the rubble covered slopes of this mountain seekers of enlightenment or just a few answers can lay their eyes upon the site of this oracle. At the very summit of the mountain lie what at a first glance seem to be the ruins of an ancient oracle. Only a second glance will reveal that all the stones of its floor and columns are actually in good repair and that the oracle hall is rather simply unfinished than in ruins. Some visitors might even wonder how its architects got the massive marble blocks of the structure up here. Even without such a burden the climb was certainly hard enough. At the very center of the unfinished structure stands a large brass brazier where petitioners visiting the oracle burn their sacrifices.

159756.name: Archaeological Dig
159756.description:
From the Introduction

Drawn by the marble fingers poking up through a slowly eroding hill archeologists have started unearthing this statue. They have dug down only a few feet, but it seems to become clear that a true marble giant has been covered by dirt and sediment here. The inhospitable land makes the dig arduous though. Water has to be brought in from far away wells as well as the wood for the scaffolding around the dig site. What few dead trees still stand are at best suitable for firewood. And the tents set up around the site provide only very little comfort as well. Still the archeologists keep going. After all, if there is something to be found they have to find it before treasure hunters and bandits descend on the dig site like vultures.

159757.name: Palace Gardens
159757.description:
From the Introduction

Surrounded by the rest of the palace gardens stands this ensemble of bushes, gravel paths and a marble fountain. Not as complicated as a real labyrinth there are still many different paths from the outside to the fountain at the center. Thus it provides entertainment and at least a small amount of privacy. Especially on hot summer days the bushes lining the paths provide some much needed shade, as do the larger trees growing around the semi labyrinth. And the fountain at the center provides refreshingly cool water channeled there through underground pipes. As the bushes are evergreens they would even provide a wonderful contrast to the show during winter.

159758.name: Gothic II: Gold Edition
videogamecompilation: Gothic II: Night of the Raven
159758.description:
User Summary

Gothic: II Gold Edition includes Gothic II as well as the expansion pack Gothic II: Night of the Raven.

159759.name: Licht aus der Asche
159759.description:
German translation of Sprawl Wilds missing the adventure "Carbon Copy" and limited to the 5th edition of Shadowrun.

German backcover:
Im Schattendschungel

Wenn man lange genug in den Megaplexen der Sechsten Welt wohnt, weiß man: Es gibt dort mehr als Supermärkte und die glitzernden Paläste der Konzerne. In den tiefen Straßenschluchten, unter dem Asphalt, jenseits dunkler Hinterhöfe existieren vergessene Gefahren und urbane Anarchie – gnadenloser als jede Wildnis.

Seattle, die große Metropole in den UCAS, ist voll von solchen Orten – und mit diesem Abenteuerband hat man die Chance, sie live und hautnah zu erleben. Ob in festungsähnlichen Farmen in den Barrens, in versteckten Kliniken oder tief im Orkuntergrund: Die Runner werden in Bereiche vorstoßen, auf die nur selten ein Licht fällt. Engagierte Aktivisten, brutale Kriminelle, lautlose Killer sind nur einige Hürden, die ihnen im Weg stehen, um ihre Aufträge zu erfüllen – und am Ende entweder mit ihrem verdienten Lohn zurück in die Zivilisation zu treten oder für immer im Dschungel des Plexes zu verschwinden.

Licht aus der Asche ist eine Sammlung von drei Shadowrun-Abenteuern für Shadowrun 5, die sowohl erfahrenen Runnern als auch Neueinsteigern stundenlangen Spielspaß gewähren. Komplett ausgearbeitet, enthalten die Abenteuer alle notwendigen Grundrisspläne, Spielleiterinformationen und NPC-Werte, damit der Spielleiter mit seinen Spielern direkt eintauchen kann in das urbane Chaos.

159760.name: Historia Eine historische Rätselrallye durch die Stadt Gmünd und das Lieser- und Maltatal
159760.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 120; learn more about historical facts of the local region.
- acting by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; draw appropiate (coloured) card and give correct answer; successful? Roll/move again (max 4 times). Ending on a red space (event card) follow instructions.

159761.description:
Nobles are used like colonists, but some of the new buildings provide different properties, depending on whether they are occupied by nobles or colonists.

This expansion has not been released separately, but can be found in the Treasure Chest and the Puerto Rico: Limited Anniversary Edition.
159761.name: Puerto Rico: Expansion II – The Nobles
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good The Board and Some Light Touching: Episode 74 “Light Player Interaction”

159762.description:
Objective: give most correct answers within a given time; learn more about the (greater) Braunschweig region
- acting by turns -

Choose a starting place; move on a grid according die roll; draw appropriate card - city or 'Hoppla' - and give correct answer/follow instructions.
159762.name: Zwischen Harz und Heide

159763.name: Witcher: Rise of the White Wolf
159763.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Witcher: Rise of the White Wolf was supposed to be a console version of the first Witcher game that was built from the ground up for Widescreen Games' DaVinci Engine and featured a host of differences. It would have featured a new interface, redesigned boss battles, new music, some new models, and a redesigned character development system, in addition to an entirely new action-oriented combat system with enhanced AI, additional motion-capture animations and the ability to directly control Geralt's defensive maneuvers.

On April 29, 2009 it was announced that the production of the game had been halted due to late payments from CD Projekt to the French developers of the console version, Widescreen Games. A release from CD Projekt's CEO Michał Kiciński stated that payments were delayed due to Widescreen games not meeting development deadlines, additionally stating that "technical incapability created a risk of missing planned quality" and that CD Projekt had ended their association with Widescreen games.

159764.name: Starbattles Center Ion Cathode Ships (Codex)
159764.description:
Center Ion Cathode Ships
2nd Expansion Race Pack for Starbattles
24 New Control Sheet Diagrams
6 Page Booklet
This set introduces a 2nd new race for the Starbattle game system.

Using centralized engines this race (referred to as CODEX)brings new effects and special rules to the game.
Booklet includes all instances where the CODEX ships differ from existing ships.

Also included is a construction notes and charts showing tech levels and build information for the 24 ship and craft types available to a CODEX player so they can be integrated in one off or campaign games

Also included is an encounter chart for determining random opposing forces. This chart includes fleet types form the original game and it\'s supplement as well as all three expansion sets.

The Control Sheet Diagrams like previous sets are meant for photocopying and only have the shields, armor and engines established. This leaves the player to determine the internal makeup and armament of each ship allowing for a very customizable game experience.

boardgameimplementation: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures In Turtleopolis Game
159766.description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures Under Turtleopolis, is graphically based on the late 80's cartoon that originated from the comic book by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

2 to 4 players play as one of the four Turtles competing around the board while trying to avoid traps and bad luck spaces. The object of the game is to reach the end of each game board, which supposedly represent a different mission:

Game 1: Rescue April
Game 2: Take Over The Technodrome
Game 3: Battle to Stop the Ooze
Game 4: Race for the Pizza Parlor

These four boards came on the back of the Ralston Cereal Boxes and as such are in conjunction a very simplistic version of similar games like "Snakes and Ladders". Just throw the dice and let luck decide in which space you´ll end up. Some spaces have rewards while others punishments. In reality is what you can expect from a board game that came on a cereal box, but it has a lot of charm and richness of details in the drawings and graphic design.

There was another Ralston´s TMNT cereal box board game called "Adventures In Turtleopolis" that came out during the same time, but it didn´t have art as nice as this nor as much TMNT thematic enemies and elements such as the Technodrome or the sewers.
159766.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures Under Turtleopolis

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
159767.name: The Sunken City Adventure Omnibus & Guide
159767.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sunken City Adventure Omnibus & Guide contains four complete beginning adventures and a host of new material to enhance your Dungeon Crawl Classics campaign. Features include:

Every best-selling Sunken City Adventure (Perils of the Sunken City, The Ooze Pits of Jonas Gralk, A Gathering of the Marked, Lair of the Mist Men) combined and refined into a single full-color volume.
Both a 96-page desktop/print version and a 200-page mobile version built from scratch for viewing on your tablet!
A massive 84-page master appendix containing extra content, pre-gen characters, player maps, 1-inch scale battle maps, and over 150 paper miniatures.
A patron write-up of Malloc, the devious master of secrets.
At long last... Opossuman player characters!
Adventure seeds, new monsters, 24 new magic items, judging tips, and more!

159768.description:
Objective: collect as many animals cards (pairs) as possible, bringing them back home & gaining bonus chips.
- acting by turns -

Roll the die and move forward on a circle; flip appropiate animal card; finding a matching pair you may bring them gome gaining a bonus chip; a dragon will let you fly, a rat will turn over all already flipped cards.

Game ends after all animals are brought home.
159768.name: Bambus-Bären-Bande Reise um die Welt

159769.description:
In Penguin Smash, players are a group of penguins that can not take the cold. To stay warm in the south pole, they figure out that they can just smash each other to keep body temperature high! (What a genius penguin!)

Penguin Smash is a dexterity game in which players will put one hand on the table and take turns flipping one card from his/her own deck of penguin cards by the other hand. If the total number of the revealed penguin cards matches the corresponding penguin player's status card, everyone must race to SMASH that player's hand on the table. The first player to smash the penguin player's hand scores all the corresponding penguin cards. The player who manages to SMASH the most penguin will be the master of penguin smash and win the game.

Be alert! Some special cards will put your penguin into sleep or sent it to dinner, and therefore making the SMASH not easy as you may imagine.
159769.name: Penguin Smash

159770.name: Krater des Verderbens
159770.description:
User summary:
Adventure for the Contact RPG which takes the PCs to a base on the Moon, where they have to face hostile aliens trying to take over their bodies and unseen horror.

Contains not only an adventure, but also additional rules for playing astronauts, as well as gear specially suited for orbital use.

159771.name: SDI
videogameversion: Amstrad CPC 464 / 664 / 6128 UK / Europe Tape edition
159771.description:
From the Sleeve

"Now the odds are even!

SDI - Strategy and Arcade action at its best! This classic Sega arcade hit, in the true Ronald Reagan Strategic Defense Initiative style, tests your skills in both offensive and defensive warfare to the limit.

It's all out nuclear war and your mission is to defend your country from enemy nuclear space weapons and save the planet from imminent catastrophe."


Single or multi-player modes
Offensive and defensive levels at each stage
Seven main tunes
Over 300 different sprites - animated deadly enemies which will collide with one another.

159772.name: Schrecken aus der Tiefe
159772.description:
User summary:
Sourcebook for the Contact RPG which focusses on underwater settings. It contains new alien races, rules for aquatic equipment and companions (like dolphins), as well as an outline for an underwater campaign called "Cold Rising".

159773.name: Contact Spielleiterschirm
159773.description:
User summary:
Game masters screen with 4 panels in DIN A4 format for the Contact RPG. It features the most important tables and summaries for the rules needed for play. The screen also contains a 16-page booklet which also mainly features tables, which give a good overview of the most important rules, but also some additional help for the GM (like tables with names or for chance events).

159774.description:
Rycerze i Zamki (which means "Castles and Knights") is a part of Egmont Polska game series: "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie".

In the game the players fight to conquer castles using their knights. Each player is given the same set of knight cards. Each knight has three powers. The powers to conquer stone, brick and wooden castles.

On each turn one castle from the castle pile is revealed and then each player selects two cards from their hands and reveal them simultaneously. The player who's combined power of particular value (depending on the castle type) of their knights is the highest takes the castle and the next turn proceeds. The player who grabs the castles with the most points on them is the winner.
159774.name: Rycerze i Zamki
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

159775.name: Das Sterbende Land
159775.description:
user summary

Second part of the "Wächter des Imperiums" campaign for Myranor. It continues the epic struggle of the people of Anthalia against the Draydal oppressors, culminating in war between Xarxaron and the undead of Draydalan.

159776.name: Myranor Meisterschirm
159776.description:
user summary

Game master screen with 4 panels in DIN A4 format for the DSA-setting of Myranor. It contains the most important tables and rules needed for play. The screen also contains a 24-page booklet with additional tables, a price list for items and stats for generic NPCs.

159777.name: Wiz-War: Bestial Forces
159777.description:
Wiz-War: Bestial Forces, the second expansion for Wiz-War, introduces three new schools of magic — Mythology, Totem, and Draconic — and six creatures storming the dungeon.

Mythology school introduces summons for creatures and powerful new items known as relics, while Draconic school focuses mostly on spells altering creature or wizard attacks. Finally, the Totem school allows different effects to be triggered by placing totems on the board: increasing the energy of spells, slowing your opponents, blocking damage, or increasing your line of sight are all possible boosts due to totem deployment.

159778.description: What the Food?! Add on – bonus player cards mixes the targeting cards “awesome sauce” and “frosting” into the mix and includes all of the action cards needed to add a 9th and 10th player to your games, pumping up the size of your tabletop food fight!
159778.name: What the Food?! Bonus Players

159779.description: What the Food?! add-on “O Canada” bonus cards (the unique combo of Maple syrup and Poutine) are fun Kickstarter extras that came up during our campaign. Someone asked in the comments if we had maple syrup, and I was shocked that we didn’t - yet. So we added this food and topping in honor of our Canadian artist and team members on the project.
159779.name: What the Food?! “O Canada!”

159782.name: Land Grab
159782.description:
A game for 2-players.

Materials

4 pawns, 2 black and 2 white.

49 Othello like tiles, black on one side and white on the other.

Definitions

Claim - An orthogonally adjacent group of friendly tiles.
Adjacent – adjacent from this point on will be considered orthogonally adjacent.

Goal

Win by capturing all of your opponent’s pawns or by having the largest claim.

Setup

Lay out the 49 tiles into an 7x7 black and white checkerboard pattern.

Then alternately starting with black, place a pawns onto an empty friendly color tile.

Rules

On a turn you must take one of the following actions.

1) Select an empty enemy colored tile that is in a straight line (horizontally or diagonally) with one of your friendly pawns, then flip this tile over and move the friendly pawn placing it on top of the tile just flipped or

2) Capture an enemy pawn by approach, this is done by moving a friendly pawn to an empty enemy tile (this tile must also be flipped over before completing the capture) that is adjacent to an enemy pawn, provided that the enemy pawn is on the continuation of the capturing pawns's movement line (which could be horizontally or diagonally) or

3) Move a friendly pawn freely within a claim that is occupied by that pawn.

The game ends when one of the following occurs.

1. When all enemy pawns are captured or

2. When players are unable of following either rules #1 or #2 after 2 consecutive turns.

Finally add up the tiles in your claims, the player with the largest claim or the player that managed to capture all the enemy pawns is the winner. If by chance there is a tie, look at each player’s second largest claim and so forth.

Restrictions

Unless performing a capture, you can't flip a tile of an opponent's claim if that claim is occupied by an opponent's piece.

159783.name: Marry me?!
159783.description:
O que seria da vida sem alguém ao nosso lado? Amizades que podem virar paixão e por que não amor?
Em marry me?! Os jogadores são pessoas em busca de sua cara metade, com gostos variados, que ao longo dos anos passaram por vários relacionamentos, terão recaídas com os “ex”, para que no final possam dizer em alto e bom som “–Marry me?” (-casa comigo?) ou não
(a vida não é perfeita).
Do que você gosta?
Pessoas mais velhas? Pessoas jovens? Loiras(o)? Morenas(o)? , independente do seu gosto pessoal, no fim o que vai realmente importar é ser feliz.

English translation:
What would life be without someone on our side? Friendships that can turn to passion and, why not, love?

In marry me?! Players are people searching for their soul mate, with varying tastes. Over the years, they may have gone through several relationships, and may relapse with an "ex", so in the end they can say loud and clear "Marry me?" (House me?) or not
(Life is not perfect).

What do you like?

Regardless of your personal taste in the end what will really matter in this game is to be happy.

159786.name: May 2014 Free Monster of the Month: Amawyte
159786.description:
From publisher product description:

"This armor-plated creature plods along on hoofed legs, licking the air as it goes. It’s horrific appearance and strange behavior made all the more unsettling by the fact that it’s walking on the ceiling."

The amawyte, a goat-legged, taste-seeing, gravity bending, armor-plated, poisonous, winged monstrosity from beyond the stars that can bite through steel.

Plus as an added bonus, a free magic item.

Enjoy this fine free monster, complements of Octopus Apocalypse.

159787.name: Hellraid
159787.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




The game was originally going to be a mode for Dead Island before it became an individual game. The game was described as a mix "the best aspects of" Dead Island and The Elder Scrolls and a spiritual successor to the 1990s games such as Hexen and Witchaven.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hellraid," available under the CC-BY-SA License.
