159797.name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Alligator 1782 / Le Fortune 1780

159798.description: An additional British flagged, Swan class ship-sloop for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'G' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.
159798.name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Swan 1767 / HMS Fairy 1778

159799.description: An additional American flagged, Swan class ship-sloop for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'G' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.
159799.name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Thorn 1779 / USS Atlanta 1781

159800.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 7 - Mar 1986)
159800.description: This issue contains a DSA scenario, new spells for AD&D, and a warrior character with stats for DSA, (Basic) D&D, and AD&D. Articles, reviews, and news are also included.

159801.description:
54 cards (27 x 2) are mixed and equally handed out. Every player searches his card deck and sorts out every pair (two cards with identical small pictures in the upper quarter of the card). After that the deck is placed upside down in front of him. The starting player shouts "Schnipp" and all players begin to reveal their cards, placing them in front of their decks. The first player who notices that a pair is revealed shouts "Schnapp" and wins both piles of the regarding players’ decks. Then the "Schnapper" sorts out the included pair(s). If the shout howevers was incorrect, the regarding player loses all his revealed cards which are then placed in the middle of the table. These cards are now handled like cards from other players in front of their decks. The player with the most pair wins.

This edition contains illustrations by Janosch - famous german illustrator, author of children's books and novelist.
159801.name: Der Tiger und der Bär spielen Schnipp-Schnapp

159802.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 13 - Spring 1987)
159802.description: This issue, published sometime between February and July 1987 (likely around April) contains articles (about Play-by-Mail, elves, magic, among other topics), news, reviews, and a fantasy scenario with stats for multiple systems.

159803.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 21 - Spring 1989)
159803.description: The 21st issue (published in March or early April 1989) contains, articles, reviews, news, the generic SciFi adventure Krügers Stern, creatures

159804.name: Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm
videogamecompilation: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Generations
159804.description:
Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm, known in Japan as Naruto: Narutimate Storm (ＮＡＲＵＴＯ－ナルト－ナルティメットストーム Naruto: Narutimetto Sutōmu?) is a fighting game developed by CyberConnect2 and published by Namco Bandai Games. The game was released for the PlayStation 3 (PS3) across North America, Europe and Australasia in November 2008 and in Japan on January 15, 2009. It is based on the popular anime and manga series Naruto by Masashi Kishimoto, and the first installment of the Naruto: Ultimate Ninja series on the PS3.
A sequel titled Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2 was released in Japan, North America and Europe in October 2010 for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.[2] Another sequel, Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 was released in March 2013.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naruto:_Ultimate_Ninja_Storm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

159807.name: Severed Umbra
159807.description:
From publisher blurb:

Swallowed by a gigantic sinkhole decades ago, the subterranean village of Severed Umbra has only recently been discovered by adventurers seeking a route to the Ebon Realm. Set around a deep, subterranean lake the villages residents – a curious mix of surface dwellers and dark creepers – live in relative peace and harmony. The arrival of surface dwellers, though, has caused tension in the village, as few of the villagers trust outsiders. With its strategic location as a staging post for expeditions into the Ebon Realm and its abundant resources of silver and precious gemstones Severed Umbra is unlikely to remain a free village for much longer.

Subterranean Enclaves are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single subterranean settlement ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure or as an adventure site themselves, Subterranean Enclaves present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

This product is a Dual Format PDF. The downloadable ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

159808.name: Kintarō: Racing Yacht
159808.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third chapter of the 0 hr Armada Codex presents the Kintarō (“Golden Boy”) class vessels: built-to-order starships for the wealthiest of clientele. Originally designed as a hunter-killer for the military but ultimately employed as police interceptors and high-end racing yachts, these sleek ships are built for speed. For the private market, the utilitarian military interior has been remodeled with luxury accommodations and components have been upgraded with cutting edge technology. No expense is spared, making a Kintarō -class yacht a status symbol as well as a top tier racing machine.

This issue also includes the Tachikaze-class police interceptor. Developed in parallel, it uses the same hull design and general layout as Kintarō but lacks the luxury décor and upgrades. It has an improved sensor suite instead of a swimming pool and detention cells rather than servants quarters, as well a barracks for half a dozen marines instead of a couple pampered guests. Both types of ship, as well as their support vessels (the Masakari jetbike and a law enforcement version of the Series-10 Comet shuttle) are fully detailed and illustrated in this chapter of the Codex.

The Kintarō package contains four highly detailed, layered PDF files:

Main Book
24 page PDF file detailing the ships, interior areas, and carried vehicles.
Contains several 3D rendered scenes as well as orthographic views of the ships.
Includes system independent statistics designed for easy adaption to your game of choice.
Background, art, and text are on different layers for custom display and printing.

Map Pages
25 page PDF file containing complete interior maps and instructions for assembly.
Miniature-scale maps for tactical combat with an optional 1 inch = 5 ft grid.
Divided into pages for easy printing in full color or printer-friendly black and white.
Selectable layers include: grid, black & white version, optional objects, and more.

2 Uncut Map Images
Two single page PDF files containing giant 24 x 40 inch images of the complete deckplans.
Both the Kintarō yacht and Tachikaze interceptor are included.
Select either a light or dark background (for printing or projection/display).
Includes layers for grid, black & white version, optional objects, and background choice.





Both Kintarō and Tachikaze ships are 195 feet long. The former, with its enhance artificial intelligence suite, can be operated by a single person but has room for five additional guests and four servants or crew. The police interceptor carries a standard crew of five plus half a dozen optional marines. It has room for four prisoners (or ten if the barracks space is repurposed for prisoner transport).

As with all issues of the Codex, this product is designed to give you ready-made ships to plug into your setting and rules of choice - lending depth and detail to your campaign. The goal is to provide a complete package, but one that can be easily broken into its constituent parts as needed. When it’s time to play, zero hour is ready!

159809.name: Centaur Class Plus Optional Rules
159809.description:
From publisher blurb:

An unusual new class for X-plorers, plus optional & flavorful rules for spce combat, gravity, and mines and asteroids.

A licensed supplement / sourcebook for the X-plorers RPG.

Easily adaptable to any d20 game.

159810.name: Small Craft
159810.description:
From publisher blurb:

Great things come in small packages!

Gypsy Knights Games is proud to present the fourth entry in our newest line of products dedicated to the starships of Clement Sector.

In Ships of Clement Sector 4: Small Craft, Gypsy Knights Games brings you not one vessel but a total of fifteen different ships! See small craft as varied as the F-212 Scorpion interceptor, the Eagle-class ship's boat, and the Orbit-class assault lander.

Ships of Clement Sector 4: Small Craft comes complete with beautiful views of each of these ships. Each ship is shown with full deckplans and statistics to make your use of our product simple, easy, and fun.

Though designed specifically with our Clement Sector setting in mind, each of these ships could easily be used in any Traveller setting.

Get on board! Adventure awaits!

159811.name: Pieces of Fate: Wyvern Coops & Easter Dragons
159811.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don't meddle in the affairs of Dragons for you are crunchy and good with ketchup!

Unless you want to get fried! Or have "escape claws" (which doesn't appear in this volume but it should). Yeah, you know weaponized wyverns and genetically engennered dragons could show up in a FATE Core game. Here's a few ideas.

Pieces of Fate tempts you with the glitter of the FATE Core system. Each slender eighth inside the virtual box holds the gleam of fiction. We implement and take ideas from inspiring images - as seen on the cover. Like many a pirate’s bounty, Take these for yourself, or make inspiration to apply your own tabletop skills for a different twist. Rite Publishing now presents the second of these to divvy up with your crew. Or just inflict upon them in a loving, cruel sort of way like they might be expecting.

159812.name: Ocean Cave
159812.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tommi Salama cartographer for Adventure Quarterly, and AdventureaWeek, presents the right map for your pirate cove needs with Rite Map Pack: "Ocean Cave”.

This multi-page PDF allows you to print out both battlemaps at a 1 square=1 inch scale as a letter-format map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version. It also includes JPEGs of the maps with and without grids for use with your favorite virtual tabletop.

This map originally appeared in Adventure Quarterly #5.

159813.name: Dungeon of Methys
159813.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeon of Methys is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Dungeon of Methys is a geomorphic set, comprising 4 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each tile features corridors and rooms in a dungeon setting with a magical theme, with features such as arcane icons, summoning circles, mysterious symbols and more. The geomporhic nature means that there are countless ways to arrange them.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

159814.name: Konito? Musik
159814.description:
The music edition of Konito?. Complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards in order to move forward on the modular scoring board. (The length of the game is determined by how many sections are used to create the board.) There is a time limit to complete each card.

The object is to be the first to complete famous song titles and lyrics, or try to make your teammates find the right answer by any possible means.

159815.name: Widows & Orphans
159815.description:
from the back of the book

Prostitutes and clowns may not be something you expect to see in one book. That's okay. They were never intended to be complimentary in the first place.

The Windows and Clown Alley were originally scripted for a Dark Champions organization book known as Shadow Syndicates two years ago. As seems to happen, however, I got Steve Long-it is, and the manuscripts promptly welled beyond the bounds of reason. They sat, distended pustules of kilobytes on my computer, too obese for a published book. There goes more work that will never see the light of day, I thought.

Then Hero Plus came along, and viola...here they are on diskette.

So now you have these two organization books in your hands: one book with a vice district filled with hookers, and the other book describing a bunch of clown crooks. What do you do with them?

Whatever you want, I guess, is the best answer. It's more in line with the grand Hero tradition of customizing your world rather than having it dictated to you.

Take what you want from Widows and Orphans, tailor it to your campaign, and disregard the rest. Hopefully, there's something you can use in these manuscripts.

159816.name: Kłuszyn 1610
159816.description:
Kłuszyn 1610 covers the battle between Polish and Russo-Swedish forces during the Polish-Russian war 1609-1618. It was one of the most glorious victories of polish heavy cavalry Husaria, where 5600 polish Husars defeated 30 000 soldiers of Sweden and Russia.

This is a typical hex and counter wargame and first of the planned series of wargames taking place in XVI-XVII century.

159817.name: Bitwy XXI Wieku
159817.description:
Bitwy XXI Wieku (Battles of XXIth Century) is a wargame system taking place in the first decades of XXIth century. The game contains maps for central Europe, Ukraine and Iraq. The units belong to the Polish, Russian, American, Iraqi, German, Ukrainian and British armies.

The counters use NATO symbols, while each units has points table for different equipment for different conflicts - for example, the three tables for polish armored units are for T-72, PT-91 and Leopard tanks.

Each hex represents one kilometer and each counter a company. The game will be also available with wooden tiles instead of counters. There are three scenarios:
- Russian attack in Bartoszyce area, Poland, in 2014
- Ukrainian-Russian fights in Crimea in 2014
- British attack on Basra during second Iraq war in 2003

Following scenarios were published in the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine:
- Biały Konwój (2/2014)
- "Japkowa" Wojna (2/2014)
- Operacja "Straż na Eufracie" (2/2014)
- Krymskie dzieci (1/2015)

159818.description:
A science fiction game published in White Dwarf (Issue 21 - Oct 1980), and was later released together with The Barbarian (a game published in a previous issue a year earlier) as one of their pocket games in Survival / The Barbarian.

Survival is a science fiction game depicting the struggle of Jardine, a crashed Scout, to reach safety. Along the trek he will meet and fight various vicious animals. While Survival is an excellent solitaire game, there are scenarios for up to six players.
159818.name: Survival!

159820.name: Star Wars-RPG.Net Online Journal (Vol. 2,  Issue 2 - Jan 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Galaxy Book Field Guide: Alien Species Edition
Imperial Guide to Cold Weather Ops
159820.description: The twelfth issue of the Star Wars-RPG.Net Online Journal.

159821.name: Star Wars-RPG.Net Online Journal (Vol. 2,  Issue 3 - Apr 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Prestige Classes... In the D6 System?
159821.description: The thirteenth issue of the Star Wars-RPG.Net Online Journal.

159822.name: Star Wars-RPG.Net Online Journal (Vol. 2,  Issue 4 - Dec 2003)
159822.description: The fourteenth issue of the Star Wars-RPG.Net Online Journal.

159823.description:
Truth is a strategic Pattern making game of Divine proportions; featuring 270 graphic Scripture cards, with a Bible verse on each card!

Become Champion of Truth by receiving Blessings, Rewards, and Victory Points, from creating various types of Patterns.

Draw and Play cards each turn. Thwart your peers from making patterns, while building your own. Making certain patterns give various special bonuses to your efforts.

There are 3 ways to win the game:
1. Collect 10 Victory Points
2. Achieve the Creation Pattern (6 Scriptures)
3. Achieve the Atonement Pattern (10 Spirits)

The first to meet one of the above Victory Conditions is proclaimed Champion of Truth!
159823.name: Truth

159824.name: Witchaven II: Blood Vengeance
159824.description:
Witchaven II takes place after the events of the first game, when the forces of darkness were triumphed over: the witch queen Illwhyrin was destroyed in her lair in the isle of Char and the evil curse was lifted. During the victory party celebrating the destruction of Witchaven, the hero of the game, Grondoval, falls into a slumber. After awaking, he is told by the mysterious female golden dragon named Ikethsti that the great witch Cirae-Argoth, one of the most powerful of Nether-Reaches Order of Witches, has arrived to avenge the death of her sister. An army of demons and Argothonian clansmen has abducted Grondoval's beloved princess Elizabeth and the other people of his homeland Stazhia to exact the titular blood vengeance and now it is only up to Grondoval to try and rescue his countrymen before they will all be gone forever. His new quest is fight his way to find and vanquish Cirae-Argoth, thwarting her plot, and to capture the Horned Skull item which would then contain her evil powers until it could be destroyed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Witchaven II: Blood Vengeance," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

159825.name: Le Truc le +
159825.description:
Le Truc le + ("What's the most?") is "the most" fast and fun party game.

Each round, players draw a "most" card to determine what they will be voting for: "The most hilarious", "The most free", "The most incredible", "The most sexy", etc. Simultaneously, they then use their Vote cards to vote for which of the five Thing cards they believe is "the most" for that category. Each player who voted with the majority of players discards a "solo" point. The winning Thing card (or cards) is discarded and replaced by a new one, then a new round begins.

The first player to get rid of all ten of her solo points wins!

159826.name: Immunity
159826.description:
Immunity is a board game in which your immune system will fight against the pathogens agents that attempt to infect your body. Become the healthiest player of the table, and live all your life free of harmful diseases! Take the control of virus, bacteria and parasites, and strike the vital organs of your rivals!

In this card game, each player receives an organism board which shows the health of your five vital systems (nervous, cardiorespiratory, digestive, hepatic, and renal), as well as your age throughout the life. There are also two environment squares that will be occupied with the pathogens before they invade your organism. In addition, the board shows different human cells (red blood cells, immune cells, platelet, etc) that can be bought with oxygen. These cells are responsible for eliminating pathogens.

There are 3 types of deck cards in the game. Pathogen cards can be placed on the environment squares of the rivals, in order to infect and harm their organs. Medic cards can be used to prevent damage, transplant organs, eradicate microorganisms, etc. There is a common deck for all the players, the environmental deck, which represents hazardous effects that can affect the health of a person, like occupational accidents, blood donation and school fights.

The game emulates in a proper way some aspects of the immunity, like the inflammation, adverse effects of medicaments, the disease transmission, the spread of tumors, and many others.

159827.name: Gruds in Space
159827.description:
User Summary

The warships need fuel and will pay a million dollar reward to anyone who can supply them. Travel the solar system, find the fuel orbs and bring them back to Pluto. But watch out for the Gruds!

This is a Graphic Adventure game with a simple two word control scheme.

159828.name: The Edgy Designer: A Dungeon World Playbook
159828.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the last of your kind: a real gamer in a hobby that has been taken over by socialists, feminists, liberals, ethnic minorities and pearlclutching fishwives. You're fighting back now, and you are not alone. You have a multitude of fans just like you, always willing to soothe your ego when people destroy your life by saying mean words at you, or harrass your targets whenever you wish to avoid the flak—after all, it's just words on the internet, you know?

As edgy as your stainless steel katana, you're a tabletop gaming auteur. From violence against women to jokes about violence against women, there's no subject you're not willing to tackle, and no length you will not go to in your quest to punish the uppity minorities and hypersensitive females who have stood up against you. You've been accused of making games that many people find uncomfortable, offensive and frankly not very good, but to you it's art, a facet of life that can't be ignored.

No matter how much they impact other people, it's your design, your opinon that matters!

You are the Edgy Designer. Bring it on!


The Edgy Designer is an edgy, light-hearted satire playbook for the Dungeon World roleplaying game which lets you fulfil your dreams of being an iconoclast game designer constantly hounded by censors and social justice warriors.

Any resemblance to real persons, living or dead, is purely coincidental.

159829.name: The Halley Project
159829.description:
In The Halley Project, the player assumes the role of a star pilot whose mission is to travel between the various bodies of the solar system. The game opens with a mix of electric guitar music and actual digitized speech — a considerable feat considering the limitations of the Apple II — during which the player is shown the text of a transmission sent from the headquarters of a body known as "P.L.A.N.E.T.":

Greetings,
You have been chosen from all the pilots in the Solar System to attempt to qualify for The Halley Project team. If you do indeed qualify, you will be invited to take part in the greatest scientific adventure in history: The Halley Project ... the Final Challenge.
Good luck, you will need it.
Neal "Buzz" Collins
Starbird 1st Class
P.L.A.N.E.T. out

The player starts out from a base on Halley's Comet and must first make his way to Earth, and then back to Halley. As longer and more difficult missions are completed, the player's rank increases from the starting level of Raven through Shrike, Vulture, Darter, Condor, Swift, Nighthawk, Falcon, Eagle, and finally Starbird.

A secret mission at the end of the game is accessible by typing in a password mailed by the software company after the player completes the last registered mission and receives a number code. The code is then mailed to "Project Halley" (in reality the software company that designed the game) on a pre-packaged postcard. A letter is then received from the software company instructing the player to load the program, go to Earth, and type MINDSCAPE to access the secret mission.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Halley Project", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

159830.name: Alternity Battle System Combat Supplement
159830.description:
From the introduction:

The Alternity Battle System Combat Supplement allows you to create fantastic armies on the field of battle! You command troops and heroes in a war against the forces of darkness!

159831.name: The Electronomicon
159831.description:
From the Forward:

Welcome to the Electronomicon, Version 2. Is it safe to look over my shoulder now? After several more nights’ work on this contribution to the Alternity game, I know a bit of how Abdul al-Hazred, the alleged author of the Necronomicon, must’ve felt. This is the ELECTRONOMICON; an alien artifact designed and used in the Star*Drive setting based campaign found on the Internet at EscapeVelocity2503). This device is based on the mythos of H.P. Lovecraft and the mythology of the Necronomicon. It is intended to be used as a constant foil and irritation to the players in one’s Alternity game; but it does not necessarily need to be used in a Star*Drive setting. This can just as easily be used in a
Dark•Matter game, or any other setting that the GM chooses.

159832.description:
Here comes the CAT FASHION SHOW! Dress your cats up and have them show off your fascinating costume design on the catwalk stage! Whoever earns the greatest fame after three fashion show seasons will be crowned the Master of Catwalk. But be alert! Don't let those copycats get all the fame out of cloning your masterpiece!

In Copy Catwalk, players earn fame points by carefully playing their cat cards (number 0-10 plus three Copycat). Cat cards with higher number (more gorgeous costumes) win you some bonus, but only if no one play the same number as yours. Playing Copycat cards grants you no fame points, but they give you chances to copy other players scored costumes in the end of every season.

Manage your cat cards carefully, predict your competitors' next move wisely, wish for the best luck using your Copycat, and you shall become the Master of Copy Catwalk!
159832.name: Copy Catwalk

159833.name: Falling Star
159833.description:
From the introduction:

an Alternity mini-scenario

Interplanetary racing vessels or extreme adventure runabouts, of the sort that the heroes must chase down in this scenario, might appeal to the Stellar Ring citizens of a somewhat wild, not over-populated system or to the pioneering pride of a more developed colonial world, such as Bluefall or Alaundril in the Verge.
This mini-scenario should suit heroes created and organised as an expert ship's crew who are used to working together. Multiple possible methods to address each scene don't assume that the heroes own a vessel. A group who are particularly well prepared with a highly-capable ship and/or specialised skills might require adjustments, such as more difficult checks or similarly-competent Supporting Cast rivals, to provide a challenge.
Heroes who are fans of the races might benefit from the specific skill Knowledge-interplanetary racing, which provides details of the events, rules, vessels and personalities involved in this exciting pursuit.

159834.name: Return to Apple Lane
159834.description:
website blurb:
This scenario requires that the Narrator has Sartar: Kingdom of Heroes and the HeroQuest Core Rules. It takes place before or during the events described in the Colymar Campaign (in Sartar: Kingdom of Heroes). It assumes the players are members of the Orlmarth Clan of the Colymar tribe and requires some modifications if the players belong to a different clan; more if they belong to a different tribe. This scenario introduces two recurring villains into the campaign: Darsten Black Oak and Erianda the Red. They are “bosses” working for the two main bosses of the Colymar Campaign: King Blackmor and Tatius the Bright.

This is different from the Apple Lane I remember!

Apple Lane was originally written as a supplement for RuneQuest back in 1978. Since then, far more has been discovered about Glorantha, especially Sartar. This scenario “re-imagines” the classic Apple Lane of 1978, updating it for Gloranthan HeroQuest.

159836.name: Atelier Rorona Plus: The Alchemist of Arland
videogamehonor: 2014 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Console Game of the Year Nominee
159836.description:
User Summary

Atelier Rorona Plus: The Alchemist of Arland is an entire remake of the original Atelier Rorona and not an enhanced port like Atelier Totori Plus and Atelier Meruru Plus. The remake attempts to fix all the issues that plagued Rorona and add in the new mechanics from the more current titles in the Dusk series.

159837.name: Persona 4 Arena Ultimax
videogamehonor: 2014 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
159837.description:
The story is a continuation of the events depicted in Persona 4 Arena and begins a few days after the previous game. The Midnight Channel is back on the air and once again broadcasts a strange advertisement for another fighting tournament christened P-1 Climax, that shows members of the Investigation Team and the Shadow Operatives in combat. Just moments after this, Inaba is subject to a power outage and is engulfed by a bizarre red fog. Furthermore, figures that look suspiciously like Mitsuru Kirijo, Aigis and Akihiko Sanada being crucified are shown on TV. While the Investigation Team attempts to figure out what's going on, Junpei Iori becomes trapped in the red fog, while Labrys and Yukari Takeba ride on a helicopter to see the fog engulf Inaba.

Source: Wikia, "Persona 4 Arena Ultimax", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

159838.name: Machine Dreams: The Sandman Invasion
159838.description:
From the Foreword:

The sandmen and their etoile masters have proved to be one of the most enduring menaces of the Dark•Matter setting - insidious, organised and ruthless. They threaten heroes not only with violence and death, but with transformation into agents of unbound machines from an unknown time and dimension.

The idea of a fan-written expansion on the sandmen, along with other major creatures of Dark.Matter, arose from the Dark•Matter mailing list in February 2002. Besides the material written for this project by James Nostack, David Tormsen and myself, the collection includes references from mailing lists, online chats and games that provided more clues to what the sandmen might be and how they operate. This work doesn't promote a new interpretation of what's gone before, but rather, many theories and directions from which to choose.

159840.name: Explore The World
159840.description:
Explore The World is a board game journey that takes players all around the man-made world vs. the natural world.

The goal is to be the first player to make a round trip back to his/her start square. Players advance around the board by correctly answering from the Question Cards or by following the directions on the Travel Cards.

The type of card used on a turn is determined by the flick of a spinner. Play continues clockwise around the table, with each player taking only one turn at a time.

159841.name: Hot Guys Making Out (First Edition)
159841.description:
website blurb:
Hot Guys Making Out is about the relationship between Honoré, a former nobleman, and Gonsalvo, his ward. They are both totally gorgeous and have the hots for each other. Also pretty often there are other people trying to kill them. It is set in a remote village in the Pyrenees during the Spanish Civil War (1930s) but you don’t have to know anything at all about the history or setting to play.

It takes 1-2 hours to play (in a 4 hour “one shot game” slot you can play two games!), is simple and easy to learn, and can be played either as a single story or as chapters in an ongoing game.

By popular demand, it includes rules for character creation.

from Welcome to Hot Guys Making Out:
Hot Guys Making Out is a role-playing game about the forbidden passion between Honoré, a reclusive former nobleman, and Gonsalvo, his young ward. It is a story about passion and romance, about love blossoming amidst the brutality of war.
…
A game of Hot Guys Making Out takes about an hour, and is comprised of 4-8 scenes.

159842.description:
A stand-alone game that integrates with Rock Science or Rock Science: Festival.

320 new questions to Rock Science. Of Bandit Rock (Swedish Radio Station). In Swedish. Boost your original game or play instantly with the included special rules.

Challenge your mates and see who is the most rock for real! Three difficulty levels and smart betting allows the beginner to give the uber nerd a fair fight. Perfect for pre-party or a hard-packed evening.

Meet the heaviest rock stars, remember the songs and hear the wildest stories.


320 new questions about the myths, rock stars, songs and albums.
Play directly with the supplied Booster Pack Rules.
Bandits host reveals juicy details about rock stars ... and themselves!
159842.name: Rock Science: Bandit Booster Pack

159843.name: Deluxe Battleship Movie Edition
159843.description:
You are at the helm in the fight for the future of the planet. Will you command the Alien Fleet or defend Humankind? Power up and scan the battlefield for locations to conceal your highly detailed, movie-based ships. Then, brace yourself for battle as electronic voice commands and sound effects signal your search-and-destroy mission to take out your opponent’s ships. Play on your own or battle a friend, and choose from three edge-of-your seat missions!

Deluxe Battleship Movie Edition has its gameplay based upon Battleship Advance Mission. There are three game modes: Classic game (One attack per turn), Multi-attack game (go again if you hit an enemy ship), Salvo game (make 1 attack for every ship you have in play). Deluxe mission also has two weapon modes: attack with only one coordinate at a time, or use advanced weapons that let you scan for enemies, shoot down enemy plans, or launch missiles for massive attacks.

Differences from Battleship Movie Edition:

Has a computer, and adds search jets, and has a 10*14 field. The two player boards are joined in the middle. The ships are smaller and less detailed. Does not come with cards.

Identical to the Advanced Mission version, with the exception of alien ships, a lighter board, and and an alien voice instead of a female one.

Green Electronic Battleship Advanced Mission differences from the earlier, blue box edition:

- improved voices and sounds (earlier said to be hard to understand)

- the original game play in a bigger, 10 x 14, grid, Salvo mission, and Target Plus One Mission, or Bonus Mission.

- advanced weapons can now be used in Salvo and Bonus Missions

- the Attack Squadron planes now move and scan on the same turn, and the planes now scan the space immediately underneath them.

- the Aircraft Carrier missiles were eliminated. The Attack Squadron planes are equipped with a one-time use only missile that automatically hits every space where it detects an enemy target. It does that on the first target found only, and then it only scans.

- the Battleship has one Tomahawk missile that hits everything in the 3 x 3 square where it lands.

- the now-called Light Missile Cruiser has two Harpoon Missiles that covers three vertical or horizontal spaces.

- the Fast-Attack Sub has two torpedoes that travel from one side to the other of the grid unless it hits a target first. The Sub also has a scanner that will tell you that an enemy ship is in the vicinity but will not tell you the precise location unlike the Attack Squadron Planes.

- the new design has a raised, inverted-Y design.

- the ships are redesigned.

- there are different colored lights to indicated launches, scans, hits and misses.

159844.description:
Rive is a multi-faction strategic game where the contents of your customizable deck (units, actions & battlefield manipulation cards) interact with a hex-based game board.

Designed for 2-4 players, and taking about an hour to play, Rive blends together familiar game mechanics to create a combat focused, highly replayable, deeply strategic and unique gameplay experience.

Attempt to destroy your opponent’s fortress before they destroy yours by playing a variety of different units, actions and battlefield manipulation cards from your hand. Each unit comes with a corresponding hex tile that is placed strategically on the battlefield. Utilize special powers unique to your faction and to your units to give you an edge on the battlefield all while taking advantage of dynamic game board features to block or trap other units.
159844.name: Rive

159847.description:
A simplified reimplementation of Ali Baba. Gameplay is similar, but the the push-your-luck aspect is missing, and there's only six dials (rather than 9), and twelve treasure cards (rather than 29).

Players turn the dials, trying to match the pattern for the round. When they succeed, they take one treasure card, which at the same time will show the pattern for the next round. Once all treasure cards have been taken, the game ends, and the player with the most points wins.


Unlock the treasure chest.

The missing treasure chest form Ali Baba has been found! You have to turn the locks into the right position. But only the one who turns the last lock in the right way, may open the chest.

On a turn a player may turn one lock 1 or 2 images to the left or to the right. When the desired image becomes visible, the lock stays open and the player may attempt to open another lock. If another image shows than the desired image, the next player is on turn.

You always have to try to get at least one lock right. You are allowed to stop at any time after that. Locks who show the desired image are not allowed to be turned anymore.

The aim of the game is to turn the locks so each lock shows the same picture. The person who manages to turn the last (6th) lock may open the treasure chest and get a treasure out. That treasure is the next image that has to be shown on all locks. The player left from the one who found the treasure starts the next treasure search.

When all treasures have been gotten out, all points on the treasure cards are counted. The player with the most points wins. In case of a tie, the player with the most treasures wins.
159847.name: Ali Baba Junior

159849.name: NUMZEE
159849.description:
Cards

There are twelve icons, each with a different point value. Each six-sided card has either two different sets of three identical icons (ie: 3 Fire icons and 3 Beaker icons), or has one set of identical icons (ie: 6 Beaker icons), known as a hextuple. (Hextuple? We made up this word. Think of a "double" in dominoes.) The value of each card is the sum of the values of each icon and is displayed in the center of each card.

Hextuples

A hextuple is a card where all the icons are the same. There is a hextuple for every icon. Every round of the game is started by placing a hextuple in the center of the playing surface. You can play just one round, or you can play multiple rounds, starting with a different hextuple each time. Choose it before distributing cards to the players.

If you play a hextuple during your turn, you can play another card during your turn to match it.

Scoring

During your turn, you play one card from your inventory by matching icons with one or more cards already played. Your score is the value of your card plus the value of the cards you matched.

Replenish

You must always have ten cards in your inventory. You can keep your inventory in your hand or just place them in front of you on the playing surface. After you play a card, you replenish your inventory by drawing a card from the pile. If you play a hextuple and are able to match it with another card from your inventory, you draw two cards.

Jokers

Jokers are wild. They can match any icon and each of the three Joker hextuples can be used to match six cards at once. They have no point value when played, but make sure you play them, because their value switches to 100 points and count against your score if left in your inventory.

Ending Rounds

Keep playing until all the cards in the pile are drawn. Then play until someone has played all their cards or until no other play can be made. Each player then adds up the card values left in their inventory and subtracts the sum from their score.

Ending Play

If you play multiple rounds, you can add the scores from each round to determine the winner. Or, you can treat each round separately and award a point to the player with the highest score for each round, and the winner is the player who won the most rounds.

159851.name: Wyld West Expansion Pack (W20)
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
159851.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Bad Moons and Silver Bullets

It was a time when a silver bullet could buy your life in a way gold couldn't. A time when the railroads barreled their way west, and the Umbral skies tore open over them. When Garou warred on Garou, divided by the ever-moving frontier, and ancient horrors broke free. In the World of Darkness, the American West wasn't just wild - it was savage.

The Wyld West Expansion Pack is a supplement that brings the mechanics and setting of Werewolf: The Wyld West into 20th Anniversary compatibility. With it, your group can uncover the lost lore of the Storm Eater and the Savage West in a modern setting, or run a chronicle set in the most dangerous frontier the Garou ever saw.


A setting overview of the Savage West and the Storm Umbra.
Gifts and rites of the period, updated to 20th anniversary mechanics.
A chapter of antagonists, from Banes and mockeries of the time to the secrets of the Enlightened Society of the Weeping Moon.

159852.name: Cemetery Crypts
159852.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cemetery Crypts is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Cemetery Crypts comprises 3 small battlemaps depicting crypts and burial chambers. These can be used as part of a planned adventure, or spontaneously when your party decides to explore a ruin in the graveyard instead of carrying on to the next town.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

159853.name: Conspiracy X: Stand in the Shadows
159853.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conspiracy X: Stand in the Shadows is a story roleplaying game about aliens, government conspiracies, and paranormal activity. Characters take on the role of shadowy agents working to neutralize an alien threat and suppress knowledge of the encounter before word gets out and the data goes viral. They are drawn from all branches of government, but serve the higher calling of Aegis, a covert arm of the U.S. Government that does not exist on paper, only as a fraternity of agents united in their shared mission to counter the alien and paranormal menace.

But it’s only a matter of time before the whole world finds out that they’ve been here all along…

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players.
The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

159854.name: AGE Bestiary: Draugar
159854.description:
From the publisher's web page:

Writer Byron Molix and Developer Jack Norris take to the frozen barrows and icy waters of the North to bring you the menace of the draugar. Restless murderous undead returned to torment the living, the draugar are a great resource for any GM looking to add some new threats to their campaign. In addition to several examples of various draugar, this product includes a template for creating your own undead monsters and customization options for the included monsters.

159855.name: The Murder Urchin
159855.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here's something you can throw at your players to watch them chuckle, then squirm, then recoil in abject terror... We present to you the Murder Urchin!

It's big.
It's hungry.
It's extrodinarily hostile.
It has stabby natual defences.
It covers itself in poison.
It likes to bite.
Its feces-caked claws cause infection.
It curls up into a Prickly Ball of Contempt.
Its stench is a weapon.
It can become a rolling ball of death.
Its extraordinarily magic-resistant.
Have we mentioned it's angry? Oh, so angry.




If you're looking to include a creature into your games that'll stink shake things up a bit, then check this out. We feel that absurd gallows humor grimdark is the way to go sometimes... There's nothing quite like some good laughs before the party is wiped out.

While this offering is system-neutral, some stats and such have been provided so that GMs with most rules systems should get idea on where to go with stats, abilities, and attributes.

159856.description:
Empire is a battle game, similar to Risk in game play, set on a map of New York City. The map has NYC (and neighboring Jersey) separated into 6 boroughs, distinguished by color palette: Manhattan in red, The Bronx in orange, Staten Island in yellow, Queens in green, Brooklyn in blue, and Jersey in purple. Each borough contains neighborhoods. These are actual neighborhoods, but the size and boundary are exaggerated in this map for game play. Neighborhoods attached by bridges, tram or subway are also considered adjacent.

The objective is to occupy all neighborhoods on the map with your player cubes by systematically booting out neighboring players by rolling higher dice values than the other players.
159856.name: Empire: The Game of New York

159857.description:
User Summary
2001 is a game for commodore 64 from Synapse software in 1988. The game. The aim is to free the space area Jaraloba from the Gorganitors. The player need to choose sectors on a map, and then battle against different enemy ships. The game is a space simulator or shooter and has some similarities to the arcade game Star Wars. The game was programmed by Bryan Brandenburg.

159858.name: Speakeasy
159858.description:
Speakeasy is a 75-minute, hidden role/social deduction game for 10-40 people, similar to games like Werewolf, The Resistance, or Two Rooms and a Boom. It is simple to learn, but has lots of room for strategy and rewards repeat playing. Speakeasy can be played at home, in a pub, or anywhere the group can fit. It is not turn-based and is played as you move around and mingle (or avoid) other players - the game happens continuously at the speed of your strategy.

THE STORY
Itʼs the Roaring Twenties, and corruption is on the rise in your city. The Mob rules the streets, and its reach extends even further—to the police force, the courts, and even City Hall. The Mobʼs crews of thieves, hitmen, bootleggers, dirty lawyers, speakeasy owners, con artists and cops on the take think they hold the real reins of power in this city.

The long arm of the law has grown shorter of late, but citizens have reason to hope. An organization of crime fighters unafraid to take a stand has emerged as a force strong enough to oppose the Mob. This crew of untouchables, vigilantes, undercover cops, honest politicians, and special agents are rallying under the new Federal Marshal in town, proving the city the forces of good might be down, but they arenʼt out!

Now itʼs time for you to choose a side and play your part in deciding the fate of the city—for better or worse.

OVERVIEW
Speakeasy is a game of creative deception, hidden identities, and strategy. To start, one player volunteers as Moderator and gives everyone a secret role on one of two teams: the Mob or the Feds. The fog of war is thick in the beginning, as playersʼ first task is to use their secret passwords to identify who to trust. As the game goes on, players learn how to hustle as they continue to identify and organize their teammates, discover the other teamʼs secrets, sow misinformation, infiltrate the opposition, and score points—all while watching their own backs. Play ends after one hour, and the winning team is the one that accrues the most points.

For more information and updates, visit thegamehaschanged.net/speakeasy or www.kickstarter.com/projects/1894392880/speakeasy-a-mob-them...

PDF OF RULES AND STRATEGY GUIDE
To see the rules for Speakeasy, just email speakeasyrules@gmail.com.

159859.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 273 - May 1998)
159859.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #273
May 1998

Cover art by Quentin Westcott.

159860.name: The Dungeoneer
159860.description:
User Summary:

A new base class for Dungeon World - a master of survival in dark underground places full of hidden treasures.

159861.description:
Grave Digger is a push-your-luck game where each player acts as one of four Grave Diggers in a race to beat a curse that causes the dead to rise.

Players take turns rolling 3 dice at a time, claiming spots on a 3x3 grid of playing cards by placing the dice on matching cards. Face cards have a value of 10, and Aces can be 1 or 11. A dice roll of double 6 can be placed anywhere.

A player can stop rolling any time, and collect any claimed cards, or must stop when no dice can be placed, losing any claimed cards.

The game ends when a player has collected 10 cards. Each other player gets one more turn. The player who has collected the most cards wins the game.
159861.name: Grave Digger

159862.name: Blaster
159862.description:
User Summary
Blaster is a shoot'em up for Commodore 64. The game consists of levels, and on each level there is a wave of aliens to shoot down. Then all aliens are dead the player will move on to the next level with a harder alien wave. The background in the game is scrolling from top to bottom. The player only have one life.

159863.name: Boom
159863.description:
User Summary
Boom is a shoot'em up for Commodore 64. You are flying in space, shooting at waves of other spaceships. Then all ships are down, you move on to the next level. The first two levels are the same, with only two ships to fight, after that there are more ships and different ships. The game was programmed by Matthias Kramm.

159864.name: Caverns of Xydrahpur
159864.description:
User Summary
Caverns of Xydrahpur is a game for Commodore 64 from 1986. The player is flying on a jetski in a spacecave, trying to go thru the system, without hitting walls and aliens. The game is not scolling, the player will go from screen to screen.

159865.description:
"Smart Guy in the pocket" in English is simple category card game.
There is letter in one side of the card and theme (mammals, cities, occupations, games etc.) in another side of the card. Turn around top card and be the first to say something that matches the theme from one card starting the letter from another card and You get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.

Other variants included.
159865.name: Tark Mees Taskus

159867.name: Cyborg 2900
159867.description:
User Summary
Cyborg 2900 is a game for Commodore 64, made in 1992. The game is a first person shooter, using 3D vector graphics. The aim is to shoot objects and solve puzzle, in a enviroment located to an alien planet with pyramids.

159868.description:
Draft your guild, plan your attack, and seize victory!

Take to the field of battle in this intense head-to-head contest of wits and strategy. Use the diverse assortment of mercenaries at your disposal to capture strategic terrain and exploit your enemy's weaknesses. With fifty different sellswords to compose your guild, no two battles will be the same!

Sellswords is a tile-placement game (they're cards, not tiles, but you get the idea) for two players in which heroes gather for the battle of a lifetime. Each of the fifty heroes has its own ability to help turn the tiles of battle in your favor!
159868.name: Sellswords

159869.name: Campeones
159869.description:
(from the coverback)
English (google translation)
Live a thrilling final as never Newteam SC between and FC Muppet!
Now you can enjoy the strength of football in this board game as simple as exciting.
Deploy your strategy, use your cards and you will get amazing goals.
When all your dreams are at stake and all your team depends on you, your passion for the game will take you to victory.
Who will win? Does the tactical skill of Oliver Atom or aggression of Mark Lenders?
Fight to the last breath!
(Based in Captain Tsubasa cartoons)



No official:This game is a faithful simulation of a soccer match cartoon of the Captain Tsubasa serie.

The objective of the game is that when you finish the game, your team has scored more goals than the opposite.
Before the game start there is the choosing to play 45 minutes or 90.

The game simulates a soccer match through a square board by both player's chips from each team as the ball moves. In turn, the player controls the team through a deck of team cards where describe the skills of each player and 3 cards of injuries on opposing players (21 total cards each player).

Player's chips can injure and even have warnings by yellow and red cards.

An interesting engine ball movement from a 6-sided die on the inside of the lid of the box with directions drawn on a grid 3x3 solves the movement of the ball where a tie in points between the player's chips.


De la contraportada:

Spanish
!Vive como nunca la apasionante final entre el Newteam S.C y el Muppet F.C!
Ahora puedes disfrutar de la intensidad del fútbol en este juego de mesa tan sencillo como trepidante
Despliega tu estrategia, utiliza bien tus cartas y marcarás goles increíbles.
Cuando todos tus sueños están en juego y todo tu equipo depende de ti, tu pasión por el fútbol te llevará hacia la victoria.
¿Quién ganará? ¿la habilidad táctica de Oliver Atom o la agresividad de Mark Lenders?
!Lucha hasta el último aliento!
(basado en la serie de dibujos Oliver y Benji)

---
No oficial:

Este juego es una fiel simulación de un partido de fútbol de serie de dibujos animados de Campeones.

El objetivo del juego es que cuando acabe el partido, tu equipo haya marcado más goles que el contrario.
Previamente al juego hay que escoger jugar a 45 minutos o a 90.

El juego simula un partido de fútbol, mediante un tablero cuadriculado por el que se mueven tanto las fichas de jugadores de cada equipo como el balón. A su vez, el jugador que controla el equipo juega con un mazo de cartas de equipo donde se describen las habilidades de cada jugador así como 3 cartas de lesiones sobre jugadores del equipo contrario (21 cartas en total cada jugador).

Los jugadores se pueden lesionar e incluso ser amonestados por tarjetas amarillas y rojas.

Un interesante motor de movimiento del balón a partir de un dado de 6 caras sobre la cara interior de la tapa de la caja con direcciones dibujadas en una cuadrícula 3x3 resuelve el movimiento de el esférico en los casos que haya empate de puntos entre las fichas de jugadores.

159872.name: Magma Rocks!
159872.description:
Summary written for VGG by Loudscoop (Publ/Dev):
Freeze lava! Dodge falling rocks! Collect gold!! In 3D!!!

The Lava Gods are out for revenge! A hapless miner, unaware that the Lava Gods are angry, has been trapped in a mine! In order to get free, the miner has to excavate the mine while collecting tools to stop the lava. When the mine has been mapped, the miner has to navigate through 3D tunnels, dodge falling rocks and hunt for gems that keep the Lava Gods happy - but only for a short while. He still has to collect enough gold to totally escape their wrath.

Magma Rocks is an adventure game that takes place in a dangerously lava-infested mine. The game switches between 2D and 3D, offering a unique gaming experience.

Will you be able to solve the 40+ levels? Are you able to collect all the gold? Can you safely get the miner out of the mines? Can you stop the lava - or will you get burned?

159873.name: Flipping Pennies
159873.description:
A children's game in which the two players each flip pennies, or some other coin, at the same time.

The players take turns calling "odd" or "even", then both players reveal their coin simultaneously.

Heads/Tails or Tails/Heads is odd

Heads/Heads or Tails/Tails is even.

This isn't much of a game, and there are ways to cheat!! But if done fairly it is a perfect example of an "Dice Rolling". The coins are randomizers. d2 or d6 doesn't matter!

So the game would play just the same if the two players rolled d6 dice and noted if the sum of the dice was "Odd or Even." Since this is a gambling game too, the players would have to each bet a stake of 1 penny.

159874.name: Defense Grid 2
159874.description:
User Summary

Defense Grid 2 is the follow up to the original Defense Grid. Originally slated to be a kickstarter game alongside DLC for the original game, the kickstarter didn't meet the necessary goal to get DG2 funded. The kickstarter funds were however later augmented with some traditional funding to complete the game.

While closely following the formula of the original, it's built from the ground up on an entirely new engine, allowing for dynamically changing maps during levels, multiplayer support, and improved leaderboards. It also adds a variety of new tower types, including the "boost" tower, which can be used as a low-cost aid to shaping, or to elevate the position and increase the damage output of another tower placed on top of it.

159875.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching the top of a palm tree with all 3 of your apes
- moving by turns -

A palm tree is built up (trunk acts as a board).

Each player tries to climb up to the top (palm branches) with his 3 apes by rolling 2 dice. Obtaining a double a chimpanzee is moved instead - kicking down all apes he's passing on the trunk (up or down).

Note: translation of the title 'I'm deloused by an ape' with the meaning: getting surprised
159875.name: Mich laust der Affe

159876.name: Vereint gegen den Feind
159876.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 80 precisely
- moving by turns -
Simple 'Roll & Move' game; use two dice until space 50 is passed. Ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Note:
Due to breeches (seen on the board) game should had been published later than 1936, likely also later than 1938 (Klee take over) although there is no 'Christian Herbart clover' logo. Theme is glorified by Nazi propaganda.

159877.description:
Expanded by:

Hat-Trick: 'Players' Expansion (2016)




Hat-Trick is a highly-tactical football card game for two players (managers) that simulates a complete football (soccer) match.

Managers use player-cards to make a football pitch and move their players, while two identical sets of action cards let them perform various actions: short passes, long balls or dribblings. Putting the ball in the final line of the pitch triggers a Scoring Opportunity phase, which is a mini-game in itself and is performed using shooting and goalkeeping cards.

The game contains 32 ready-to-play national teams of variable strength. Moreover, it is possible to customize your own teams based on any club in the world.
159877.name: Hat-Trick

159878.name: Schlaraffenland
159878.description:
Objective:
Be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -

Each player moves forward according die/dice roll (use one die only during very first three rounds and after passing space 90);
follow instructions glued into the lid ending on a marked space.

Notes:

Translation: cockaigne, mythical land of plenty;
Educational approach praising work & diligence;
Likely published ~1910s; as usual cute pewter pawns

159879.name: Killsplosion: The PVP RPG
159879.description:
from the website:

Killsplosion is a role playing game created by Ross Payton, co-host of Role Playing Public Radio. It began as a ransom model project using Kickstarter in October 2011 and was first released publicly in March 2012.

Unlike most RPGs, which are cooperative storytelling games, Killsplosion focuses on competitive, player versus player narratives. Each PC is a hardened badass straight out of an action movie, ready to do what it takes to win. However, unlike other action RPGs, the PCs are not meant to work together. Everyone’s out for number 1.

Killsplosion is a free RPG, available in PDF.

159880.name: Anduin (Issue 85 - Dec 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Der Drache und der Phönix I
159880.description:
Anduin is revived unexpectedly (and unexpectedly soon). Issue 85 contains some Voodoo material (articles and scenarios) as well as more general content.
It also includes an adventure for the Austrian RPG Runemaster.

159881.name: Equipment Cards Volume III
159881.description:
From publisher blurb:

This third set of cards designed for use with the Mutant Future game created by Goblinoid Games, though easily adaptable to other OCR type game systems for sci-fi or sci-fantasy type settings. The Print and Play PDF consists of four face sheets, four backing sheets (alternating) with the face sheets consisting of six cards each. Also, the PDF version consists of Adobe layers and a full color version, greyscale version, and black and white version can be generated from the same file.

159882.name: Equipment Cards Volume IV
159882.description:
From publisher blurb:

This fourth set of cards designed for use with the Mutant Future game created by Goblinoid Games, though easily adaptable to other OCR type game systems for sci-fi or sci-fantasy type settings. The Print and Play PDF consists of four face sheets, four backing sheets (alternating) with the face sheets consisting of six cards each. Also, the PDF version consists of Adobe layers and a full color version, greyscale version, and black and white version can be generated from the same file.

159883.name: Heroes of the Sea (PDQ)
159883.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wartime roleplaying…
…with tentacles!

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a two-fisted wartime roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazis, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary war machines, and enough writhing tentacles to fill ten Reichstags! Heroes of the Sea PDQ is the second standalone adventure supplement in the globe-spanning Zero Point campaign using the PDQ system and requires the PDQ rules included in the Three Kings PDQ release.

Play soldiers, agents, and resistance fighters in the chaos and carnage of the Battle of Dunkirk, as a sinister conspiracy threatens the lives of the retreating Allied forces!

Inside you will find everything you need:

A standalone multi-episode adventure for several sessions of play!
New rules for PDQ wartime investigations, including tanks and Stukas!
Maps of Europe and the evacuation at Dunkirk
An “Operational Briefing” and many other beautiful handouts!
Four pregenerated characters to get you playing immediately!

159884.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume VI
159884.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the game of Pathfinder, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume I, and its successors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 21 mythic spells, from cure moderate wounds, mass to detect poison. Using this book, you can make a delayed blast fireball that is not only much more devastating, but also gives you much greater control over the delay and the conditions that cause it to go off. If you prefer more subtle magic, use demand to send suggestions to several creatures at once, even if you’ve never met them. Detect evil not only gives you more detailed information about an evil creature’s aura, it can even be used to delve into their past and discover what sort of evil deeds they have performed.

Don’t wait: get your hands on the latest mythic spells now!

159885.name: Codic Keep
159885.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the name Codic Keep used to have prestige associated with it in the past, it is now a crumbling fortress blasted years ago by a large tornado. Now the ruin sits next to a swamp and is pretty much left ignored. Recently word has reached Feastelburg that strange lights have been noticed near the keep and many have wondered if the wanted criminal relative has returned to reclaim the property. Wanted posters of “Si” Codic have been circulating for quite some time with a reward of 1500 gp for his capture. Who’s up for a swamp trip?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a medium level party and a DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159886.name: THOGS - Hunters for the golden Sirbul
159886.description:
From the Introduction:
THOGS - Hunters for the golden Sirbul is an independent, simulationistic fantasy RPG by Ilmari Virtanen based on it's totally own fantasy world.

THOGS was not designed in an instant, it has been developed since 1989 and has now evolved to it's third version (v3). One prominent feauture of THOGS is the strange and funny names of creatures, that have been a trademark of the game from the beginning. In v2 all the remaining regular names had been changed to suit the world of THOGS. But do not let the names prevent you from enjoying the game.

VERSION 3
THOGS version 3 returns to it's roots, so all the information is back inside the same covers. So THOGS v3 includes everything from the v2 world book as well. In v3 the rules are same as before, but the descriptions of player character races have been built up. All the races have now official appearance descriptions, preferred professions and age. The skill system taking into account the racial features is established. The magic system has been widened to include subtypes and combinations of elemental magic and over 40 new spells are introduced. The use of weapons is now more free, you just need a combination of strength and hands to use a certain weapon. The professions, special skills and personalities have also been revised. Overall the outlook of book has been improved for better readability and ease of us.

159887.name: Die Reise um die Erde
159887.description:
Objective: be the first turning back home (space 110); learn more about the world.
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on marked space follow instructions glued into lid;

Notes:
Should had been published ~1900s;
Activities like visiting an opium den in China convey a feeling about the spirit of that time

159889.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 100; learn more about chocolate
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game, describing the process of getting raw materials for chocolate production; ending on marked space see instructions; some spaces require usage of a letter die.

Note:
Game was delivered with 250 gr. chocolates inside.
159889.name: Wir 5

159890.description:
Taggle d'amour is an expansion to Taggle that may be played standalone.

Taggle d'amour adds 35 'Thoughts' and 20 'Retort' Love-themed cards to the classic Taggle game.

As in Taggle, each player draws a 'Retort' card. Each turn, a new player reads out loud one of the 'Thoughts' lines and the other players, one after another, must use one of their 'Retort' lines to snap back the silliest or funniest retort. The player who read the "Thoughts" card then gives a "Taggle" counter to the player who provided the lamest retort.

Once a player has accumulated 5 "Taggle" counters, he is declared loser.
159890.name: Taggle d'amour

159891.name: Autobahn
159891.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 69; learn traffic rules/signs
- moving by turns -

Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

159892.name: Zahlenzirkus
159892.description:
Objective: Learn numbers between 1 and 24
- acting by turns -

Flip 24 tiles upside down (symbols or numbers) - other corresponding 24 matching tiles stay visible.

Randomly draw one one of the flipped tiles and find within a given time the matching one; the 'puzzle' concept let you prove if right or wrong.

Game ends after all tiles are merged. Player with most matching pairs is the winner.

159893.description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
159893.name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – B Zestaw

159902.name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – L Zestaw

159903.description: The players travel the Sol-System (between Earth, Luna, Venus and Mars) and try to accquire Property Cards with allow them to build space stations, rockets, landing crafts or atom reactors. The players have to pay a fee, if they land on a space that belongs to another player, even more it that player has already build something on this space or if the player has several properties on this planet. The last payer who has any money left or the player who has the most money after an agreed upon playing time, wins the game.
159903.name: Flug ins All

159904.description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. 159904.name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – M Zestaw

159905.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 60 (Nimes)
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; starting from Marseille each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a black marked space follow instructions.
boardgameversion: VEB (K) Kartonagen und Bürobedarf Karl-Marx-Stadt edition
159905.name: Rund um das Mittelmeer

159907.name: Моя Весела Ферма
159907.description:
My Happy Farm is a game in which players strive to become the best farmer.

All players have their own farm with four nice animals. They feed those cuties. Animals which are fed well fill their stomachs with tasty food, grow and become longer and longer, even reaching unnatural lengths. The longer your animal, the better a farmer you are. The owner of the longest animal receives bonus points. Animals which aren't fed even one time lose their weight, take offense, and leave their bad master. Moreover, they will take some victory points from the bad master to punish him, so players have to be good and careful farmers and feed their animals well to create Their Own Happy Farm.

This is a new edition with new art and the box is already contains the expansion Gazda.

159908.description:
Each player tries to make the largest pens with his own sheep inside by placing his own tiles. You can easily close small pens, or you can be ambitious and try to build large farms... but if you cannot enclose the fields, your sheep are likely to be eaten by the big bad wolves roaming in the nearby forests. Each player's animal is secret at the beginning of the game, but the soonest you reveal it, the more points you get.

This edition includes the expansion.
159908.name: Wilki i Owce (zawiera dodatek Grube Ryby)

159909.name: Grand Master
159909.description:
User Summary

Grand Master is an action-RPG for the Famicom.

The player controls Rodi, a knight on a quest to save princess Serena from Dante the Demon King. Rodi wields a variety of weapons including a sword, axe, moringstar, and a magic rod. The game consists of 5 main stages which can be played in any order; followed by the final stage in 6 parts. The order they are played in will effect the stories plot. It's even possible to get a bad ending if the stages are played in the wrong order.

The gameplay is in the style of The Legend of Zelda. You explore areas in an overhead view, find treasure chests, and defeat bosses. There is a simple leveling system with experience points. You can find items and upgrades such as a shield, armor, and weapon upgrades.

159910.description:
You are a pioneer. You must build your settlement up into an epic Kingdom. Choose your land and structures carefully to optimize how many resources you produce.

On a player's turn you choose an action: Develop, Produce, Build, and Consume, and perform that action on your turn. Victory Points are gained at the end of the game for your size of your settlement, the buildings, and the resources you produce. The game ends when either the tile stack runs out OR there are no more VP tokens OR someone has filled all the spaces on their board. The player with the most Victory Points is the winner!
159910.name: The King of Frontier
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 500 - Best of 2015 + Contest Resolution!

159911.name: Euphoria, The ultimate reality show is about to begin
159911.description:
From the back of the box (translation from spanish):

"Each night two teams will fight to be a step closer from the goal, that big target, the dream of everyone of them, the great $300.000 reward to make their dreams come true. There is no rules, all is allowed, and for once It is the end that justifies the means.

Take your seats, get ready to watch something will leave no one indifferent, the newspapers will write about it for days, at your home, at your work, everytime, something never seen before on TV.

EUPHORIA, THE ULTIMATE REALITY SHOW IS ABOUT TO BEGIN-"

Euphoria is an estrategy game for two players with 2 teams of 4-6 miniatures (clones for the "show") each. There is no, factions, armies, countries, or whatever, each team is a band freely arranged by the player up to a maximun cost of points called "audience" here.

Each character has different attributes, skills and special rules and habilities/powers (once per "show").

You either can play a mission scenario with an objective (i.e. Rescue a character) or massacre game trying to defeat your opponent's team. The match is limited to 10 rounds (Typical game: 1 hour long with Audience 800 and 4-6 minis per team in a 120x90cm table).

Starter pack ("VHS box" package) content:

- 4 Metal miniatures (Nikolai, Madeleine, Kabuki, Sooyoung) and 2+2 round bases (30mm and 40mm)
- 3 Resin barrels
- 5 10sided dices (2 white 0-9, 2 blue 0-9, 1 blue 00-90)
- 4 Dials (0-15, required assembly)
- 20 "drop" counters (adrenalin, healt, grenades, etc).
- 65 Pags. color printed rulebook
- ID Player Card

159912.name: Asteroil
159912.description:
From the rules:

Asteroil is the game of space mining. Into the vast reaches of the solar system two players maneuver the space fleets of competing corporations as they vie for the immeasurable wealth contained in the asteroids. Repulse cruisers hyperspace in and out to gain position while the space refineries close in fast. The company that meets its quota first gets the jump on the market to control the world's supply of platinum, titanium and gold.

Description:

Asteroil is an abstract strategy game played on a 12x12 square grid. Each player controls a space refinery and four repulse cruisers. A turn consists of moving a piece one space in any direction, jumping a cruiser in or out of hyperspace (off the board; jumping in allows the cruiser to go to any space), or firing a cruiser's repulsion beam at an asteroid. The beam causes the asteroid to move away from the cruiser; ideally the player's space refinery is on the other side of the asteroid, allowing it to be captured. The player who manages to capture three of the six asteroids wins the game.

159913.name: Pyramad
159913.description:
From the rules:

Pyramad is the game of pyramid power. The cosmic forces of intuition and chance meet head on with the powers of observation and logic in this multilevel game for two players. Like the Pharaohs of ancient Egypt, each players seeks to build and possess a pyramid by stacking cards drawn from the special 92-card deck. Until the last card is played, you will be hanging on the edge of your throne.

Description:

Pyramad is played on a 6x6 square grid using 92 square cards. Each card shows a pattern of four squares colored red, blue, or white; red and blue are the players' colors and white is neutral.

On a turn a player either draws a card or plays a card (playing is required if a player has five cards in hand). A card can be played on an empty space or on the intersection of four cards, but the latter play can only be made if the intersection has fewer than three squares of the opponent's color.

The object is to either place the single card on the sixth level of the pyramid or make it impossible for your opponent to play.

159914.name: Alphabid
159914.description:
From the rules:

Alphabid is the game of crosswords. Using identical sets of color-coded letters, two players match vocabularies by drawing, bidding and playing, crossword style, as many letters per word as possible. As the grid fills up, the players may begin to risk their turns in an effort to make longer words than the opponent. The final outcome remains undetermined until a player has drawn the last letter and the opponent cannot catch up.

Description:

Alphabid is played on an 18x18 square grid. As indicated by the description in the rules, each player has an identical set of tiles. However, each starts off with a random selection of eight of these. After the first turn, a player must start their turn by "bidding" the number of tiles they think they can play; this entitles them to draw that many tiles, after which they can raise their bid in order to draw more tiles. After they have bid as high as they want (or they have eight tiles, which is the maximum) they must play at least as many letters as they bid. If a player plays eight tiles on a turn they draw eight more without having to bid.

Play follows standard Scrabble rules: words are played left-to-right or top-to-bottom and all orthogonally adjacent letters must form words.

Plays do not score points. Instead, the object is to draw all of one's tiles. If both players manage to do this on the same turn, the player who has the fewest tiles left wins.

159915.name: Harder They Fall
159915.description:
From the publisher's website:

Giants have mostly kept to themselves while the Coming Storm approaches, only taking part in those battles they knew would not give away their future plans. Now, in Harder They Fall, the full range of their abilities and their goals have been revealed to be added into any Part-Time Gods story.

Includes

7 New Giant Types and Expanded Mechanics for Existing Giants
Rules for playing as Giants, including new Giant-Sized Relics
Brand New Giant Adventure!

159917.name: Zombie: the Coil
159917.description:
from the introduction:

The purpose of this game is two-fold.
