The duel of fate is today!
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Tong_Pass_(211)

The Silver Lion has three campaign screenplay. They usually takes 40-120 minutes.

Time scale: Each Game Turn equals 3days.
Unit scale: Each step equals 2500men or cavalrys.

159506.description:
After a nuclear disaster, the contaminated water has created these deadly monsters in the sea. They then sought land where the human civilization was nearly decimated. They then turned on each other in a monster war like no other. Only the fastest and strongest shall win!

Kaiju is a fun party game in which players are the monsters in battle, and they roll a die and have to perform the action as quickly as possible. The slowest person gets a wound which is drawn on by the crayon marker, and the one who gets six wounds is out. The box is also part of the components and is used during the game.

Kaiju comes with two sets of rules, one for the main game and another for a mini game.
159506.name: Kaiju

159507.name: Urban Panic
159507.description:
The world of investments awaits, but be aware, the task is very responsible. The player's goal is to build a city with the help of five loyal helpers. Architect, mayor, planner, engineer and a spy will do all they can to create new places of public use so that living in your metropolis is more comfortable than anywhere else.

In the centre of the Urban Panic play area is a main board with open city tiles placed on it. Next to the board lies a face-down pile with the remaining tiles. Each player receives a player board, and on this board you will build a city. In your turn, you have to perform actions of the architect which will enable you to take one tile from the main board. In the current turn, you can perform two more actions. You may exchange all of the revealed tiles with those from the pile, place a tile on your board, or change the places of two tiles on your board. Each building added to the city results in its development: number of residents, number of workplaces, ecology, revenue or the satisfaction of residents either increases or decreases. The most important thing is to fill the board with city tiles so that each tile is connected to the center of the board. You cannot forget to fulfill the needs of the residents. The winner is the player who not only builds and develops the city fastest, but avoids unemployment and takes care of the residents' needs.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
2015 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
159508.description:
News from the depths! The AquaSphere is a research facility stationed deep below the ocean's surface, and your skilled team — consisting of an engineer, a scientist, reprogrammable bots, and exploratory submarines — is trying to gather as much data as possible.

The game board in AquaSphere has two main areas: A research station comprising six sectors in which your scientist conducts experiments and a headquarters where your engineer supervises preparation of the bots. During each of the four game rounds, you take several turns, and on each turn you either:


Use your engineer in the headquarters to program a bot; each round you can choose from three of the seven actions.
Have your scientist bring a bot to a sector to perform an action.


Through actions such as improving your lab, sending out submarines, collecting crystals, and examining octopuses, you expand the abilities of your team or gather knowledge points, which are necessary to win. Additional challenges result from the limited size of your lab, which is your personal stock; you can increase the size of your lab, which makes life easier, but this costs valuable time.

AquaSphere is a challenging game of strategy and tactics with different paths to victory that requires planning in advance as well as skillful use of short-term opportunities.
159508.name: AquaSphere

What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 71!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 72!!

159509.name: Schattenrüstzeug
159509.description:
The (altered) German version of the Runner's Toolkit

German Description:
Nie mehr unbewaffnet!
In die tiefen Schatten der Sechsten Welt sollte man nie unvorbereitet eintauchen: Eine Waffe ist immer gut. Zwei sind besser. Drei und ein Granatwerfer, ein Magier und ein Hacker – und es kann eigentlich kaum noch etwas schiefgehen.
Schattenrüstzeug ist die ultimative Box für alle Runner und Spielleiter in Shadowrun. Es ergänzt das Grundregelwerk zu Shadowrun 4 und enthält folgende Komponenten:
· Einen stabilen vierseitigen Spielleiterschirm mit allen spielrelevanten Informationen im Überblick.
· 4 vollfarbige Karten von Orten in den Sprawls der Sechsten Welt.
· Das Abenteuer „Schattenkrieg“, ein Shadowrun-Einführungsabenteuer, das für den Spieleinstieg konzipiert ist, aber auch von Profis gespielt werden kann.
· Das Schattenwerkzeug, das neue Kontakte, Abenteuerbeispiele und –orte beschreibt und vorstellt. Zudem enthält es das CGHS, ein modulares System zur simplen und schnellen Erstellung von Spieler- und Nichtspielercharakteren, sowie Anatomie eines Shadowruns. Letzteres beschreibt einen typischen Shadowrun und bringt dem Spielleiter anhand dieses Runs gleichzeitig die Regeln, die Proben und die Systematik eines Abenteuers nahe.
· 6 vollfarbige Referenzbögen, die dem Spielleiter zusammen mit dem Spielleiterschirm lästiges Blättern zu Kampfregeln und Probeabfolgen ersparen. So wird der Regelteil des Leitens ein Kinderspiel.
· Eine Tabellenzusammenstellung aller Tabellen aus Arsenal 2070, BodyTech, Runnerkompendium, Straßenmagie und Vernetzt – unter anderem die ultimative Einkaufsliste für alle Schattenläufer.
· Den Masterindex, der sämtliche Schlagwörter für Grundregelwerk, Arsenal 2070, BodyTech, Runnerkompendium, Straßenmagie und Vernetzt auflistet.
· Ein Poster mit der Skyline von Seattle.
· 3 Shadowrun-Aufkleber.
Mit dieser Ausrüstung trifft das Schattenrüstzeug tief in das Herz jedes Shadowrunspiels – für flüssigere Abenteuer, coolere Settings, spannendere Plots. Und es unterstützt die Runner im Spiel, damit sie enden wie die Profis: Reich oder tot.

English Translation by Google
The ( altered ) German version of the Runner's Toolkit

No more unarmed !
In the deep shadows of the Sixth World , one should never immerse unprepared : A weapon is always good. Two are better. Three and a grenade launcher , a magician and a hacker - and it can hardly go wrong or something .
Schattenrüstzeug is the ultimate box for all runners and game manager in Shadowrun . It supplements the core rulebook for Shadowrun 4 and includes the following components :
· A stable four-sided game master screen with any game- relevant information at a glance .
· 4 full-color maps of places in the sprawl of the Sixth World .
· The Adventure " Shadow War ," a Shadowrun introduction adventure that is designed for starting out , but can also be played by professionals.
· The shadow tool , the new contacts , Adventure examples and Place describes and presents . In addition, it contains the CGHS , a modular system for simple and fast creation of player and non-player characters , as well as Anatomy of a Shadowrun . The latter describes a typical Shadowrun and brings the game master uses this runs the same rules , the samples and the systematics of an adventure close .
· 6 full-color reference sheets that save the game master with the game manager screen less scrolling to combat rules and sample sequences. So usually part of directing is a breeze.
· A table compilation of all tables from Arsenal in 2070 , Bodytech , Runner Compendium , street magic and interconnectedness - among other things, the ultimate shopping list for all shadow runner.
· The Master Index , which lists all keywords for core rulebook , Arsenal 2070 Bodytech , Runner Compendium , street magic and interconnectedness .
· A poster with the skyline of Seattle.
· 3 Shadowrun stickers.
With this equipment the Schattenrüstzeug strikes deep into the heart of every Shadowrunspiels - for smoother adventure , cooler settings , exciting plots. And it supports the runners in the game, so they end up like the pros : Empire or dead

159511.name: Firun-Vademecum
159511.description:
User Summary
A manual that provides all the information players need to add background and depth to their clerics of Firun, God of the winter and hunt, as well as Ifrin, godess of spring. It includes prayers, canticles, rituals, holy books, and other background information on the cults of Firun and Ifirn.

159512.description:
Game description from the publisher:

For the third time, Munchkin explores your favorite myths and legends! Munchkin Legends 3: Myth Prints introduces the Gladiator, who gets tougher when his life is at stake! This 56-card set has new monsters to fight, new Treasures to gain, and dozens of new jokes to enjoy! (Or groan at — your choice.)
159512.name: Munchkin Legends 3: Myth Prints

159513.description:
This game is based on 6-Tage-Rennen by the same author. Everybody has the same hand of movement cards. Each player plays one cards and moves his pawn accordingly. If he lands on the the spot as fellow player he may move the same number again immediatly.

Instead of a bike race however, Auf Gehts! simulates a race of Biathlon. The card play is similiar to 6-Tage-Rennen, but the track features slopes and hill where slthly different rules apply. Every round there is a shooting, which is simulated by a real-time-dexterity element using a small "Marble gun".

First to cross the finish line is the winner.
159513.name: Auf geht's!

159514.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Rather than rot the teeth of your trick-or-treaters this year, why not rot their minds with a Munchkin Halloween Pack? Each of the twenty packs contains four Munchkin cards — with the same four cards in each pack — and a quick explanation of the game. No one has to have a bellyache in the morning!
159514.name: Munchkin Halloween Pack

159515.description:
In Operation F.A.U.S.T. (Fine Art Underground: Stolen Treasures), players take on roles of independent art patrons in occupied France during WWII. This was a period when Europe's greatest treasures were at risk of being looted by the Einsatzstab Reichsleiter Rosenberg (ERR), a special unit of the Third Reich tasked with plundering cultural valuables.

Each player will work to acquire the most prestigious collection of art treasures through bluffing and deception. The first player to reach $1,000,000 in black market art value immediately wins the game.

Players execute one of multiple possible actions on each turn with the goal of gaining enough intelligence to recover at risk master works. 

Player’s may use deception to advance their goals, but risk losing their intel if caught in a lie. When a player earns enough intel, they may acquire a piece of art that has a specific, but secret black market value. Art gained may be forged or considered “degenerate” making it more easily confiscated.

To win this highly interactive game, a player must take risks, use cunning misdirection, uncover and remember where valuable art resides, and employ strategies to acquire the most valuable collection more quickly than the competition.
159515.name: Operation F.A.U.S.T.
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dukes of Dice - Ep. 46 - Con-Quest

159517.description:
Get Bit! Collectors Edition contains Walk the Plank!, Get Bit!, and Hold Your Breath! — three independent games that collectively tell a larger story.

In Walk the Plank!, players represent the worst pirates in a captain's crew. The captain has rounded you all up because you're all lazy and stupid and simply not worth the rum and loot you get paid. That said, the captain has decided he's willing to keep two of you in his crew. To prove you're worthy, you will fight amongst yourselves, trying to shove other players' pirates off the end of the plank while keeping yours alive!

Get Bit! is a card game in which the player pirates find themselves in the ocean, competing to stay alive as others are being eaten by a shark. The order of the swimmers is determined by simultaneously playing cards face down, then revealing the values. The number on each player's card determines position in line (higher numbers in front, lower numbers in back), however ties don't move. The swimmer at the back loses a limb to the shark and is flung to the front of the line! The process is repeated until only two swimmers remain on the table. When this happens, the swimmer at the front of the line wins the game!

In Hold Your Breath!, the game is played in two rounds. In the first round each player may dive deeper, providing they have the "Swim" and "Air" cards to do so. Players press their luck each turn since it is the pirate who dives the deepest in round one AND resurfaces in round two who is the winner. Players can play "Panic", "Shark" and other nasty cards on the other players, slowing their progress. In the second round each player struggles to reach the surface before they run out of air and therefore decide to take a rest (aka LOSE). Most of the pirates may not make it back to the surface, but the one who makes it back alive AND dove the deepest is the winner.

Included in each copy is a bonus chipboard with a newly designed pirate ship, an additional "Captain" stand-up starting token, and even some hunger tokens to go with the now included Sharkspansion for Get Bit.
159517.name: Get Bit! Collectors Edition

159518.name: Salem Village
159518.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Evil lurks in the heart of Salem. But is it witchcraft, the Devil, or just the bitterness and envy of your friends and neighbors?

This is the first Kingdom seed release from the Kickstarter campaign. It’s inspired by Peter Adkison’s new short film The Devil Walks In Salem, which was itself based on the fantastic Salem Fiasco game I played with Caroline Hobbs, Jerome Virnich and Pat Kemp.

159519.name: Put On the Mask
159519.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It’s time to put on the mask and imagine yourself changing the life of your city. This script also has a new character type: the Straight Man!

159520.name: MurderHobos
159520.description:
from Brent P Newhall's Musaeum of Fantastic Wonders

MurderHobos is a tabletop RPG made for when you just want to kill things and take their stuff.

You roll different dice. Your character strangles things with his hands, stabs from the shadows, or calls down unholy fire from the sky. You play a MurderHobo.

The game package includes:


A 6-page PDF containing all the rules, with awesome art by Khairul Hisham and Peter Seckler.
An .azw3 file for use on newer Kindles.
( A .mobi file for use on older Kindles.
An .epub file for use on iPads and other eReaders.

159521.name: Global War
159521.description:
User Summary

An early computer version of the classic board game “Risk”. Players battle for 42 territories of the world. There is no AI but up to 9 players can play in hotseat fashion.

159522.name: The Magnate
159522.description:
User Summary:

A new base class for Dungeon World - a wealthy man with estates, entourage and an eye for business opportunities.

159523.description:
Last Saga is a skirmish wargame played with 32mm miniatures.

Different factions fight against each other in a science-fiction universe: The Council, survivors of the human race; Uruhvel, users of powerful biotechnology; Raiders of Saanar, corsairs and pirates eager for loot; Guardians of Tanaor, high and proud of their advanced technology.

Games portray confrontations between two small groups of units controlled by players, filled with action and where tactics are key to victory!

Receive your actions each turn and use them wisely on your units. Examples of actions are: "Fire and movement", "Rapid fire", "Race", etc.

Every situation is resolved by a 2D6 roll, on a fast paced action where you will not lose sight of the game goal: accomplish the mission.

Configure your Combat Force, set the mission, and work for the success!
159523.name: Last Saga

159524.name: Titanic-opoly
159524.description:
Inspired by the Titanic – The World’s Largest Museum Attraction, the board game allows you to re-live the grandeur of the ill-fated ship. But don’t become too immersed in the history, your aim is to buy up all the sea-faring properties and win the game!

Join your opponents and sail through Titanic history while buying up your favorite Titanic rooms and galleries in 1st, 2nd, and 3rd class - but don't run out of cash. Try to avoid paying port taxes and watch out for ice fields ahead.

Features:

Full colour game board with a Titanic theme.

“Purser's Office” and “Ice Field” cards replace traditional Community Chest and Chance cards.

Money is printed with a helm design.

Includes six collectible tokens – anchor, shovel, coal, captain's hat, helm and key.

Traditional houses and hotels are renamed “Cabins” and “Suites”.

Set also includes two dice and an instruction booklet with the rules of the game, plus rules for 60-minute speed play game.

159525.description:
One hundred and fifty years have passed since the first match in the Galactic Arena. This ancient mystical arena was originally located in an abandoned Serpente subsystem forgotten by time. After the First Apocalypse, the Terrans built endless numbers of space platforms to colonize space, and an agreement was brought forth between the Terrans and a mystical sect of great influence to lease the space platform CETUS-7. The ancient arena was rebuilt on top of the platform, taking the galactic fights into space.

The Atomic Brotherhood holds all the broadcast rights for the Arena, netting them trillions of Credits for every minute of every fight. Their aptitude for organizing unconventional games makes them exceedingly popular with the masses, and now the time has come again. Gladiators from all over the galaxy are gathering on CETUS-7. Only five heroes will survive to face the coming Apocalypse. The Oracles have spoken the words: "May the Zenites shine upon you." Those who cannot understand their meaning are destined to meet their doom.

Apocalypse Universe: Galactic Arena, the first of five projects set in the Apocalypse Universe, is a strategic science fiction "hero vs. hero" game that takes place in the Galactic Arena of CETUS-7. The guiding principle of this game is replayability. Each hero has different stats and abilities, allowing unique builds that depend on player choice.

The game is played by 2-6 players and can be played as 1vs1, 2vs2 or 3vs3. In 1vs1, the players follow a draft procedure and pick 1-3 heroes out of the ten available. After both players have chosen their heroes, they prepare them to enter the Arena. Heroes can equip weapons and special abilities before combat. The arena board consists of a grid of hexagons with starting positions, secret traps, and treasure crates.

Both players secretly choose, then reveal heroes, placing them on the two starting positions of the board. The hero with the highest initiative score plays first. The player controlling him is considered the attacker and his opponent is the defender. Each hero has a number of action points that can be used to perform his special abilities, to defend, or to attack. A ten-sided die is used for attacking and defending. The attacking player adds his hero's attack score to his attack roll and the defending player respectively adds his hero's defense score to his defense roll. When a hero is wounded, he loses health points — and at zero health, he's defeated.
159525.name: Apocalypse Universe: Galactic Arena

boardgameintegration: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Dwarves of Runegard
Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Elves of Ravenwood
Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Men of Hawkshold
Battleground Historical Warfare: Second Punic War 218-201 BC
Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Dwarves of Runegard
Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Elves of Ravenwood
Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Men of Hawkshold
Battleground Historical Warfare: Second Punic War 218-201 BC
159526.description:
This is an expansion for the Battleground system, although it can be played as a stand-alone game since it contains both opposing armies and the rules, containing the armies of Alexander the Great and the Persian Empire and explores Alexander's invasion of Persia. Alexander vs. Persia is compatible with all other Battleground armies; each AvP army can be played against any others in the Battleground system.

To simulate Alexander and his generals leading from the front, the Alexander army features the ability to attach general-specific command cards to a unit and then to replay the card on that unit. The large and relatively unwieldy Persian army enables its general to sacrifice command actions at the start of the game in order to receive extra points for army building.

There are official solitaire rules for the Battleground series of games downloadable at the company website.
159526.name: Battleground Historical Warfare: Alexander vs. Persia

159529.name: Rifts Adventure Book Hook, Line and Sinker
159529.description:
user summary

A Game Master Reference And Adventure Handbook

159530.name: Puzzle Fun Pak
159530.description:
User Summary

Puzzle Fun Pak is a collection of four puzzle games for DOS.

Block Five is an expanded version of Tic-Tac-Toe, involving a 19x19 grid and the goal of making a row of five symbols before the opponent can do so.

Asteroid Rescue is a little arcade style game where a ship must be navigated through an asteroid belt in order to pick up astronauts.

In Phrase Master, the player guesses letters in a phrase with the guesses' worth being determined by a random spin of a wheel.

Maze Machine generates a maze that can be solved on screen or can be printed out to be done by hand.

159531.description:
The Gambler Expansion is an exciting new addition to Spurs: A Tale in the Old West. 10 new Equipment Cards, rules for a 2 player game, and a new 6th character, The Gambler, complete with bullet bag and cowboy miniature!

Everything you ever wanted to make your Spurs Core Game playable for 2 or 6, or anything in between. Will you become the next Legend of the Old West?
159531.name: Spurs: Gambler Expansion

boardgamecompilation: Agents of SMERSH: All the Kickstarter Promos
159532.description:
Promotional extras shipped out to Kickstarter backers of Swagman's Hope. These include three new UN characters, a new henchman, a new deck of Secret Mission cards, and an epic Space Station scenario.


1 Henchman mat
The Gambler

3 UN Character mats
Mosé Calderón
Tilly Philips
Grant Massey

3 plastic standees
21 Secret Mission cards
Space Station Scenario and tokens
Instructions
159532.name: Agents of SMERSH: Swagman's Hope Kickstarter Extras

159533.name: Small World: Pocket Encyclopedia
boardgameaccessory: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
159533.description:
From the back cover:

This book is a reference guide for players of Small World the boardgame and Small World 2 the videogame.

Part artbook, part reference guide, this volume includes the rules of the game, an official FAQ, detailed design notes from the author and the illustrator, extensive glossary and 63 encyclopedic entries detailing every single race and special power from Small World and it's Be Not Afraid..., Cursed!, Grand Dames and Royal Bonus expansions.

A copy of these items is still required to play.

159535.name: & (Issue 9 - Summer 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Creature Feature I: Stat the Harpoonapus!
Creature Feature II: Ecology of the Dragon Turtle
Creature Feature III: Ecology of the Oculus Despot
Domiciles & Emporia I: Some Businesses in Gamington
Introduction to the AD&D Spell System
One Page Dungeon: Juju Zombie Bandits
Spell Caster's Paradise I: Expanding the Globes of Invulnerability
Spellcaster's Paradise II: The Spells of Errgo the Immobile
Tactical Magic: Vancian Magic and Scroll Spells
The Toybox I: New Weapons VI – Rome and Other Random Weapons

159536.description:
Hungry as a Bear, part of HABA's "My Very First Games" series, allows youngsters to play with their food — their fake food, mind you, with six cardboard dishes being available (blueberries, carrots, etc.) and two copies of each dish. The rulebook includes three games:


Little Bear Is Very Hungry: a co-operative game in which players roll the die, then try to feed the stand-up bear by placing a dish on the spoon and pushing it through the bear's mouth.
Little Bear Is Starving: a memory game in which players try to match the food dishes on offer.
What Is My F-F-Favorite Dish?: a guessing game in which one player secretly chooses a dish as her favorite and the others take turns asking questions and trying to guess the dish.
159536.name: Hungry as a Bear
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series

159537.description:
Published by E.S. Lowe in 1963, this word dice game may be played individually or in partnership.

Included are 13 letter and value cubes, a cup to throw them, and a timer. The player throws the cubes and tries to form words in crossword or Scrabble fashion as quickly as possible. Jokers appear on two of the cube faces. The challenge is that all words must be connected. Each letter has a point value, and the summed value of those used is the positive score while points are deducted for those unused. Letters used in more than one word are counted for each word.

Other known editions are 1973 and 1975, which were published under the label "E.S. Lowe, A Milton Bradley Company".
159537.name: Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes

159538.name: Trivial Pursuit: Family Edition – Card Set
159538.description:
Here\'s the perfect Trivial Pursuit edition for kids and parents alike. This Family Edition Card Set features two boxes of questions - one specifically for adults, one tailored just for kids - to give everyone a chance to win in these categories: People & Places, Entertainment, History, Science & Nature, Sports & Leisure, and Wild Card.
Grown-UPS will test their trivia memory on everything from Thomas Jefferson to the Ayatollah... Cobb to Clemens... Pearl Harbor to Kuwait City;... and Trump Tower to the Ozone Layer. The kids can show what they know from Dinosaurs to Gerbils... Adam and Eve to Cabbage Patch Kids... the Little Dipper to the Little Big Horn... and the Alamo to Oz.
Trivial Pursuit Family Edition... It\'s fun for all - and all for fun!

159539.name: Mini Metro
videogamehonor: 2015 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Debut Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Honorable Mention
2016 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Winner
2016 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2016 Steam Awards Sit Back and Relax Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Honorable Mention
159539.description:
User Summary

Mini Metro tasks the player with building an metro rail network of gradually increasing complexity. Passengers arrive at a station with an intended destination represented by a symbol. The player starts with three lines that they can use to connect stations. Over time, new stations spawn that the player needs to connect to their network. Every seven days the player is offered the choice three randomly selected upgrades (additional lines, double rails, station upgrades, more tunnels, increased passenger capacity, etc.) in order to cope with the growing demands upon the network.

Play proceeds until the player is no longer able to service the passenger demands and waiting passengers overflow at one or more stations.

159540.name: Das Schwarze Auge - 5. Edition - Beta-Regelwerk
159540.description:
user summary

The rulebook for the ongoing beta test of the 5th edition of "Das Schwarze Auge".

159541.name: Das Tal des Todes
rpgseries: Das Schwarze Auge (DSA) 5th edition beta adventures
159541.description:
user summary

A beta test adventure for DSA 5th edition. This one takes the heroes into the djungels of Meridina.

159542.name: Die Gunst des Fuchses
rpgseries: Das Schwarze Auge (DSA) 5th edition beta adventures
159542.description:
user summary

A beta test adventure for DSA 5th edition. This one takes the heroes into the intrigues of the Empire of Horas.

159543.name: Die Quelle des Nagrach
rpgseries: Das Schwarze Auge (DSA) 5th edition beta adventures
159543.description:
user summary

A beta test adventure for DSA 5th edition. This one takes the heroes into the ice of the Bornland.

159545.name: Evy: Magic Spheres
159545.description:
Evy, a small orphan girl, has a great power within her. The power is revealed when she enters a fairytale kingdom and must battle some extremely evil monsters roaming the area. Being able to control the magic spheres, she uses them to defeat the foes who want to start trouble. Help her save the magical realm from the clutches of an evil witch with spectacular match 3 action! Time to end the reign of terror in Evy: Magic Spheres!

Source: The Publisher Website.

159546.name: Level 22
159546.description:
Gary is an office worker, and he has a problem: He is late at job. His real big problem is that it's far from being his first lateness. So now, Gary run the risk to get fired at any moment if some of his colleague catch him in the act of being late. He will need to use all the stealth and tricks he has, to be able to climb the 22 floors leading him to his office. And he will have to do it, without getting noticed.

THE FIRST STEALTH GAME INSPIRED BY THE UNFORGIVING AND HECTIC WORLD OF OFFICE WORK

Hide in closets, crawl in pipes, hug the walls… you don’t want anybody to spot you!

Use whatever you have on hand to reach the end of the level: coffee machines, pen, donuts, photocopier or laxative!

Source: The Developer Website.

159547.name: Sweezy Gunner
159547.description:
Sweezy Gunner is an eye melting, brain bending, mouse squeezing 2D Shoot em up. destroy everything in your path, Upgrade the Sweezy Gunner ship. A Large open World! Travel through the lush green fields, frozen tundra and arid desert. Explore the depths of the many dungeons, caves and temples and collect that tasty loot!

Source: The Developer Website.

159548.name: Tr-Zero
159548.description:
User Summary

This motorcycle racing game can be played single or multiplayer in races including up to 40 motorbikes. It allows for some weapons and for different racing modes including time trial, regular race, and weapons.

159549.name: Overcast: Walden and the Werewolf
159549.description:
User Summary

This game follows an old hunter investigating a creature who is killing people from a nearby village.

159550.name: Steam Bandits: Outpost Explorer's Equipment Pack
159550.description:
In Steam Bandits: Outpost, you play as the newly-hired skyrunner of a burgeoning trade outpost in the floating world of Stratos. It’s up to you to manage your outpost and assemble your party to explore the furthest reaches of the skies. Armed with only a handful of gold, your dashing good looks, and a kindly clockbot assistant, you’ll run into obstacles and misadventure, but success will earn you a place as one of the wealthiest, most stylish denizens of Stratos.

Source: The Developer Website.

159551.name: Megabyte Punch
159551.description:
Described best as a mash-up of SSB, Megaman and Custom Robo. Megabyte Punch is an electro fighting/beat ‘em up game in which you build your own fighter!

As you travel through different environments, you battle other creatures to get their parts. Parts have their own powers and bonuses, like gun arms for a shoot ability or powerful hips for a devastating pelvic thrust attack. Then, using the abilities of your customized fighter, you can compete in the tournament or battle against other players in a destructible arena.

The game takes place in an computer world where you protect the Heartcore of your village against the likes of the Valk Empire and the dreaded Khoteps in 6 different levels with each 3 stages and a boss fight!

Source: The Developer Website.

159552.name: Gomo
159552.description:
Gomo is a point'n'click exploration game created by Fishcow Studio. Help Gomo to save his dog and best friend Dingo on his journey.

Source: The Game Website.

159553.name: From The Ranks To Field Marshal
159553.description: A game produced in Britain during the First World War for the soldiers at the front. Each player enlists as either a Private, Sapper, Gunner or Trooper depending on which arm of the armed forces they join, and as they progress around the board they get promoted through the ranks. Whoever becomes Field Marshall is the winner. Along the way are various events which may accelerate or hinder your progress.

159555.name: Das Schlaue Musikrodil
159555.description:
This is a quiz game where the players have to answer questions about music theory, instruments and history in order to advance and collect the name, birth of date and portrait of specific composers.

Contents:
1 Board
1 Rulebook with the answers to the questions.
320 Question cards.
100 Composer cards
8 Gameplys figures
2 Dice

159556.description:
Scarborough Fair is a resource selling game for 2-4 players. Players will buy and sell four resources; Parsley, Sage, Rosemary and Thyme. They will set the prices that they sell each resource at, place Merchants in tents and buy Victory Points to give them the lead. But the customer is a shrewd shopper so don’t raise your prices too high or you’ll be left holding resources that you can’t sell. Pick the prime locations, corner a market or undercut your opponents to win.

Scarborough Fair is not a complicated game to learn and is fairly quick to play, but it has enough strategy to keep more seasoned gamers interested. It's a great game for families and hard core gamers alike.
159556.name: Scarborough Fair
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game of Crowd Funding JT Smith Interview 06-04-2014

159557.name: Fish In A Barrel: The Fish-Linking Game
159557.description:
The Fish-Linking game and more fun than a barrel of monkeys. See how many fish you can catch before time runs out! Includes eight fish (three bass, three trout, and two muskies) in a wood-pattern barrel that’s easy to transport to the campsite or even carry along on a fishing trip! Includes stringer, 60 second timer, and rule sheet.

Randomly place all 8 fish on a flat surface...turn over the 60 second timer....grab a fish and link as many together as you can (tail-hook to mouth-hole) before the timer runs out. Earn one point for every fish you link and a bonus point if you link all fish species of the same type back-to-back (example, all bass one behind the other). The player with the most points wins the round and gets to string up their "catch" for show (stringer included).

159558.name: Iron Gauntlets Classic Reprint
159558.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Harken back to the days of fantasy adventure.

It is an age when heroes ventured where the mass of humankind dared not tread - into a fantastic world of arcane wizards, bold warriors, powerful kings, and fell beasts. The voyages were perilous, but the rewards were great. Iron Gauntlets will thrust your heroes into epic swords and sorcery quests. Will they find glory or treachery, triumph, or an early death?

No classes or experience levels, Iron Gauntlets keeps it simple with consistent and flexible rules. The game is designed for people to tinker with it--because gamers almost always do. Add your own races and skills, or even create new magical powers.

Create a wide range of characters, from shaman and barbarian warriors to paladins and knights. If you can imagine it, you can create it. Unlike most other games, experience can have a direct influence on a character's actions: expend experience at will to increase the odds of a task or save it to raise a skill level between game sessions.

This Classic Reprint of the Iron Gauntlets softcover includes the sample setting of Amherth, introductory adventure, and companion book for lots of options.

BONUS 1: The included Companion material expands your Iron Gauntlets experience with new player, combat, and social conflict options, as well as sample difficulty ratings and new storytelling advice.

BONUS 2: The PDF includes a sampling of Disposable Heroes® paper miniatures and full color, tiled maps to help bring the action to life.

159559.name: Deadly Delves 1: Fane of the Undying Sleeper
159559.description:
From publisher blurb:

Protected by the roiling waters of the ocean, the Fane of the Undying Sleeper lies at the top of a set of stone steps only exposed at the lowest ebb of the lowest spring tides. Protected by impregnable stone doors, the fane has lain undisturbed for centuries. Once the lair of a heretical and degenerate demon-worshipping cult the benighted, profane place has never known the tread of human feet. None have yet penetrated the fane, but nevertheless wild and outlandish rumours speak of terrible dangers and glittering treasures to be found beyond the impregnable doors.

With a tide low enough to reveal the fane’s entrance fast approaching, are the PCs brave enough to dare the terrors of the Fane of the Undying Sleeper?

A Deadly Delve for 3rd-level characters by Creighton Broadhurst.

Deadly Delves are short, self-contained richly detailed adventures. Designed specifically to be both easy to insert into almost any GM’s home campaign and to be completed in one session, Deadly Delves include everything you need for a great dungeon bash. Each Deadly Delve features a new layout designed expressly to make the GM’s job as easy as possible.

This product is a Dual Format PDF. The downloadable ZIP file contains two versions, one optimised for printing and use on a normal computer and one optimised for use on a mobile device such as an iPad.

159560.name: Equipment Cards Volume II
159560.description:
From publisher blurb:

This second set of cards designed for use with the Mutant Future game created by Goblinoid Games, though easily adaptable to other OCR type game systems for sci-fi or sci-fantasy type settings. The Print and Play PDF consists of four face sheets, four backing sheets (alternating) with the face sheets consisting of six cards each. Also, the PDF version consists of Adobe layers and a full color version, greyscale version, and black and white version can be generated from the same file.

159561.name: Gravewalkers
159561.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gravewalkers are a strange race of halfundead humans exposed to dark energies that have altered their physiology on a fundamental level. Shunned by most, the Gravewalkers build small ghettoes in ruins or near graveyards or old crypts. They are often morticians or grave diggers- they act as caretakers for the dead, but also use them as a form of labor and protection for their grim communities.

The rare Gravewalker heroes often become especially skillful, tenacious undead hunters. They take it upon themselves to hunt down wild undead and put them to final rest. Perhaps they do so because they view such animate dead as monstrous perversions of the scared rest all dead deserve, or perhaps they hunt the dead out of self loathing or self interest…. by destroying predatory undead they prove to fully-alive humans and other races that their race is more than just a collection of ghouls.

159562.name: Scrap Liner
159562.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The ship introduced in this installment of the series is an old and rusty Liner that in the eyes of some should rather be srapped.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

159563.name: The Dark Brigade
rpgseries: Cartoon Action Hour Season 3 Series Book
159563.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eleven years and two Cartoon Action Hour editions later, the Dark Brigade series (by Eddy himself) is back due to popular demand!

In this deluxe Cartoon Action Hour: Season 3 series book, the elite para-military group known as the Dark Brigade finds itself at odds with the vampiric Lord Syn and his vile Brotherhood of Death, as they wage war all over the world in an exciting struggle of good versus evil!

Information about the ficticious cartoon series.
Exhaustive details about the two factions and their various ally groups such as EVE X and the Order of Charr.
Write-ups and stats for 15 Game Master Characters, 9 vehicles, 2 playsets, 6 weapons, 5 types of Goons and 3 generic minor villains.
Information about the various supernatural races found in the series, including two varieties of zombie, ghouls, gillmen, two varieties of vampires, wolfmen, goblins, witches, mummies and golems.
Details for creating your own Player Characters.
Twelve episode seeds, including the epic "Darkness Unleashed", The Dark Brigade movie. Additionally, each seed includes advice for setting up and running it.
Tons of fantastic art!

159564.name: Wasteland Ruins III
159564.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wasteland Ruins series covers random, often generic, city, town, village, and even random smaller ruin locations for post apocalyptic games. They are meant to be used by GM's looking to set up a quick area for an urban encounter. Don't mistake them for generic though! Each map is highly detailed with random decorative elements put in to make the apocalyptic wastelands feel more alive than ever!

Wasteland Ruins III is focused on a common city river walk. Evidence of older battles can be found here, whether that be the partially destroyed office building, or the doomed M1 Abrams tank. Other minor details that give the map life include a statue to a fallen war hero, a potentially working anti-air tracked vehicle, and a collapsed bridge that may have fallen either due to age or damage from the battles that took place in this area long ago.

As with any of Stoneworker Cartography's battle maps, there is no need to print out the entire battle map. If you prefer, you can simply print out specific sections of this map and save the other parts for later! Be sure to refer to the included map print key to help you figure out which sections to print if you're only interested in certain smaller sections of the battle map.

PRINT ON DEMAND FANS NOTE: Stoneworker Cartography is in the process of converting all of our map products into print on demand files, meaning no more worrying about having enough ink, or even bothering with cutting and taping your maps together! Instead, let us print and cut for you! In the very near future you will be able to buy pre-printed, high quality maps from Stoneworker Cartography, including this one. Keep an eye on Wasteland Ruins I and The Galleon as they will be the first to be released as pre-printed products, with more coming soon. Please check back often and like us on Facebook for up to the minute updates of when other maps go live as print on demand products!

Features:

Standard 1" = 5' Scale.
96" x 72" in size. Print out the entire night club or just print out the sections you need.
Hex, Square, and No Grid versions.
Full Color versions – These maps are printer intensive, full color versions of each level.
Black & White versions - A black and white version that is far less ink intensive than the full color versions.
VTT Map – If you prefer to play your games online, there is an included VTT map properly sized for use with VTT software.

159565.name: 101 Not So Random Encounters: Forest Kingdom
rpgissuearticle: 101 Not So Random Encounters: Forest Kingdom
101 Not So Random Encounters: Forest Kingdom
159565.description:
From publisher blurb:

When 1d6 Owlbears just won't cut it!

It's a savage, and untamed wilderness out there your trying to explore and conquer, and for players, it's gotten nastier. 101 Not So Random Encounters: Forest Kingdom gives you more options, more creative flexibility, and more ways to just freak out your players with layered narrative encounters as they try to make themselves into Kings and Queens.

Enjoy the vine hamadryad druid who in her despair and wrath seeks to merge the primal plane of the fey with your world, though first she and the PCs must overcome a paragon olethrodaemon who spreads the seeds of pestilence about the land leaving blight and contagion in his wake. Or enjoy the remnants of a cyclopean empire, led by their last great leader as he struggles against the predations of the mortal races and the arrival of the daemons.

Brought to you by the best-selling and critically acclaimed author Mike Welham (Pathfinder Module: Doom Comes to Dustpawn). This plug in for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Games most popular kingdom building adventure path brings you a vaster array of new options to surprise even the most jaded of players. 101 Not So Simple Random Encounters: Forest Kingdom gives you the creative oomph you've come to expect from Rite Publishing, and it'll give your party something to remember for a long time - if they survive!

159566.description:
In Unicorns in the Clouds, players become one of the magical unicorns in the game and race from the thundercloud to the sun, trying to collect as many cloud crystals as possible along the way.

To start, all unicorns stand on the thundercloud. On a turn, a player rolls the blue storm die and either moves 1-3 clouds or stands in place eating a muffin, forgetting all about the race, the crystals, and everything else. If you land on a pink cloud, you roll the crystal die and receive 1-3 crystals; if you land on a present, you give someone else a crystal from the reserve; and if you land on the front end of a rainbow, you slide along the path to the next cloud. Whoever reaches the final cloud first claims the four crystals there, then players compare their holdings to see who horned their way to victory.
159566.name: Unicorns in the Clouds

159567.name: Brigands' Den
159567.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Brigands' Den' it's a new supplement form The Forge Studios from Tactical Maps line.

It's set of color battle tiles of 2 level brigands hideout located in a cave. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map.

The supplement also consists of:
full stats of 5 brigands in 3 versions:
for encounter level 3/6/9/. Basic tactics for each brigand.
The stats are designed for D20

159568.name: Lairs and Hideouts
159568.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Lairs and Hideouts' is the fourth set of color battle tiles by The Forge Studios. It comprises 24 full color tiles of monsters lairs and villains hideouts suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map. Furthermore - the product contains 24 black & white Tactical Map sheets designed for DM to write in modifiers for cover, movement, etc. All tiles are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

'Lairs and Hideouts' is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign. However it works best with 'Strongholds 1: Manor' and 'Medieval Landscapes'.

The set includes:

24 5"x 8" color battle tiles.
24 Tactical Map sheets with pre-generated modifiers.
24 Tactical Map sheets with blank space left for DM to write in modifiers.

159569.name: Lands and Fields
159569.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Lands and Fields' is the third set of color battle tiles by The Forge Studios. It comprises 24 full color tiles suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map. Furthermore - the product contains 24 black & white Tactical Map sheets designed for DM to write in modifiers for cover, movement, etc. All tiles are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

'Lands and Fields' is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign. However it works best with 'Strongholds 1: Manor' and 'Medieval Landscapes' from The Forge Studios.

The set includes:

24 5"x 8" color battle tiles.
24 Tactical Map sheets with pre-generated modifiers.
24 Tactical Map sheets with blank space left for DM to write in modifiers.

159570.description:
In SOS: Sheep in Trouble, players need to save their sheep from a tropical island, preferably before the boat gets too far from shore and definitely before any other sheep reaches the ship first.

To set up, each player places a sheep figure on her starting card and her ship tile close at hand. On a turn, she rolls the die, then takes a seaside card of that color, flips it over to reveal the rocks on the other side, then places it in a path leading from the island. If on a future turn, she rolls a color that's already in her path, instead of adding another tile to her path, her sheep crosses a number of rocks equal to the number of rocks of the rolled color in her path. Whoever first reaches her ship with her sheep wins!
159570.name: SOS: Sheep in Trouble

159571.name: The Village of Briarton
159571.description:
From the back of the book

From Humble Beginnings...

The village of Briarton is a village setting book written for the d20 System, and suited for use in any fantasy world.

Whether the characters need a place to rest, recuperate and refit for new adventures, the GM needs a starting point for a new campaign, or the players want a detailed locale from which their characters hail, the Village of Briarton is ready to serve.

The Village of Briarton contains everything you need to know about the colorful inhabitants, intriguing history, possible adventures and dark secrets of this seemingly peaceful farming village.

The Village of Briarton contains:

48 villagers, from craftsmen to shopkeepers to retired adventurers, including detailed d20 System writeups and backgrounds
11 interesting, fully detailed places of business
6 brand new spells
2 original deities (one good and one evil)
2 original domains -- Hearth and Pestilence
1 deadly new monster




...Heroes are born

159572.name: Deep Dig
159572.description:
A press-your luck card game with an underground theme.

Players play as treasure hunters exploring deep underground, facing monsters such as giant earthworms and lava swimmers, and dangers such as narrow bridges and tunnel collapses.

Each turn the active player purchases tool cards with various special abilities. Then they encounter monster and danger cards from the dig deck until either they choose to stop digging or a card knocks them out. They score treasure based on the number of cards they encountered that turn, but only if they weren't knocked out.

Once the dig deck is depleted, whoever has the most treasure wins.

159573.description:
Players in Taxi Wildlife want to give rides to as many animals as they can, while also traveling far into the forest.

To set up, each player takes a colored start cards, each of which shows a single path on one edge that branches into two paths at the opposite edge. Players place two each of six kinds of animals into two separate bags; someone shuffles the duel cards (after first removing any colors not in play), then places the four round cards in numerical order. Shuffle the three stacks of route cards, then reveal one card from each deck; each route card depicts an animal on the sign next to a taxi stop and some cards also show the animal on the card.

In each round, you'll draw the duel cards one by one, and for each duel card the two players shown on the card each take a bag, then race to find one of the animals depicted on a face-up route card in their bag — without looking inside the bag, mind you. If a player finds the wrong animal, then the opponent can still find one; if the player finds the right animal, he takes the matching route card from the display and tries to add it to his start card on either the left or right side. The number of paths on adjacent cards must match! If they don't match, the player returns the card, gaining nothing, and the next duel card is drawn. In addition, if the route card actually depicts the animal in question, the player keeps the animal token instead of returning it to the bag.

Once all the duel cards have been used, shuffle them and reveal the next round card. After four complete rounds or after one stack of route cards is empty, the game ends. Each player scores one point for each route card in her path and each animal in her collection; whoever has the high score wins!
159573.name: Taxi Wildlife

159575.description:
Dracula, bored and hungry, has thrown a masquerade ball, and invited all the townsfolk for dinner (and maybe a few for dessert). The problem: Some monsters in clever disguises have crashed the party. The bigger problem: Van Helsing is afoot, and everything is at stake.

It's murder on the dance floor, but which monster will divert attention to the others and have the feast to themselves?

Will the Werewolf sate its hunger? Will Dr. Jekyll unleash her wild side? Or will Van Helsing save the townspeople and ruin the party for everyone?

Dracula's Feast is social game of logical deduction for 4 to 8 players. It takes 5 minutes to learn, and less than 10 minutes to play.

Each turn, players guess, accuse, or dance with another player. Once they have enough information, they reveal their role and attempt their Grand Reveal, unmasking the entire party - but certain characters have unique victory conditions, and so it's a race against the rest of the party to be the first to win.
159575.name: Unmasked: Dracula's Feast
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #35 – Dracula’s Feast
Episode 61 - Mansions of Madness 2nd Ed. Halloween Spooktacular
Episode 65 - Conan BA Holiday Special
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 138

159576.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from VFG, a company in Germany.
159576.name: Monopoly: VFG

boardgameimplementation: Battle of the Bands: Backstage Pass
Battle of the Bands: Encore Edition
159577.description:
The premier Rock and Roll Card Game is back...but now it's taking over the world! Battle of the Bands: World Tour Edition, the game where you are the star of your own music group.

This new edition represents the natural evolution of the original Battle of the Bands game and its expansions. The game mechanics have been streamlined, tightened, and improved over many years of play. New cards have been added that reflect the changes in music and the industry since the first Battle of the Bands incarnation. Famous cities and venues have been added to truly make this the "World Tour Editon"

With new cool and crazy band members and instruments, reputations that will elevate or cripple your band...you will be armed to the teeth when you hit the stage! Perform Hit Singles, work the Music Biz and ultimately blow your competition off the stage as you fight for Gigs all over the world!

Originally the basic game had a 13+ age level, now it's all ages friendly. BUT if you don't want to play Radio Disney you can add the Sex, Drugs and Rock and Roll expansion for the real band experience! With the Back Stage Pass and Front Row Center cards, you will expand your gaming experience to new heights and depths, just like the the music business. Pop, Rock, Metal, Punk, Funk, R&B, Country (and Western!), Thrash, Swedish Black Metal, Jazz... even the questionable sounds they call "music" today! It's all here for your gaming enjoyment.

A great gateway game for folks who love music but aren't into games...yet.
159577.name: Battle of the Bands: World Tour Edition

159578.name: Sweet Sabotage
159578.description:
Sweet Sabotage is a board game about maids, butlers, desserts, and SABOTAGE! Build and serve your customers desserts to please your master, or destroy other player’s progress through sabotage! The cafe inheritance is on the line, make sure YOU win it!

Players start by choosing a maid/butler, and each of them have specific skills. Customers come in with their dessert card order, and the player has to collect ingredients to fill up the dessert card and serve the customer successfully. Be sure to act fast though! Some customers are impatient and will not tolerate slow service!

If you can't find the ingredient you urgently need, or you have to prevent someone from serving their final customer and winning the game, you can draw a Sabotage Card. These cards are powerful, and allows you to steal ingredients from other players, or even wreck their dessert forcing them to start over... but be careful! You can draw a CAUGHT card and you lose points!

The first player to reach a certain amount of favor points (gained from serving desserts to customers) wins the game, and the inheritance of the whole cafe!

159580.name: Hiyoko Drip
159580.description:
Enter the world of the Mame-ista Championship! Who will be the best Hiyoko dripper? \"Hiyoko\" means chickpea, but these chickpeas are so cute they almost look like little chicks.

Players take turns in trying to tip out a combination of beans. But you need to be careful as sometimes 1 bean may tip out...or a LOT! Only the player who is able to get the right combination of beans over a certain amount of rounds (depending on the number of players) can be declared the Mame-ista winner!

On a turn you tip out some beans, if you get a blend/straight combination you can try one more time to get another combination. If you are unsuccessful, you remove 1 bean from the ones that fell out, and try one more time.

159581.description:
Welcome to the world of Pro Wrestling! You must win at any cost or face the wrath of your sponsors. This year there are 6 new wrestlers debuting, so go out and win some matches!

Over the 4 seasons whomever has won the most points is the winner. In a round, players can play cards or pass on their turn. Players play 1-3 cards on their turn of the same type of Wrestler (that hasn\'t already been played), to help resolve the strength of the wrestler. The faster you get rid of your cards, the better your chances of winning. As soon as you rid your cards you get to take the highest point token available, then the next player to go out gets the next token. Once there is only 1 player remaining, the round ends and that player gets the -1 token.
159581.name: maskmen
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 166: Boyband Roadtrip Edition

159582.name: Tesla Effect: A Tex Murphy Adventure
159582.description:
Tex Murphy wakes up - disoriented and head pounding - on the fire escape outside his office atop the Ritz Hotel. Another typical morning for the last of the old-school detectives. Except it isn't. What starts out as the worst hangover in history becomes a baffling nightmare: something - or someone - has erased Tex's memory of the past seven years. Motivated by lost love, revenge and the world's strongest coffee blend, Tex must retrace his own steps into a maze of unsolved murders, hidden agendas and lost technologies of Nikola Tesla. Only by solving the mysteries of his past can Tex hope to regain his memory in time to restore what's been lost and stop a terrifying future.

Source: The Game Website.

159583.name: Go (1983)
159583.description:
User Summary

1 or 2 player can play this early computer version of the classic strategy game “Go”.

159584.name: Quaff
159584.description:
Quaff is a collectible card game with fast-paced gameplay and a sense of humour.

The object of Quaff is to eliminate all other players whilst simultaneously attempting to remain in the game. Pick a deck - be that the horde of zombies, the superhero, the spaceship, or the fantasy army - and sparingly play cards to take down your opponents.

At the start of each round, players bid to determine the total cost of the cards they can play this round - however this is linked to the amount of drink consumed. Cards, ranging from permanents (which remain in play until removed by the effects of another card) to counters (which can be used on an opponent's turn to hinder their strategy), are utilised to decrease a player's life points. Once they reach 0, they are eliminated.

159585.name: Lorakis Weltkarte A0
159585.description: Special version of the world map of Lorakis, the world of Splittermond, in A0-format. It is twice as large as the normal version of the map, which can be found in the setting book for Splittermond. It is only available directly throught the publisher, for example via the Uhrwerk webshop or on conventions.

159586.name: Pulp Fantastic
159586.description:
publisher's blurb:

In the years after the Great War dawns a new age of heroic adventure!

From the gleaming spires of the big city, to the steaming jungles of Skull Island, brave men and women fight the forces of evil, carving their legends into the history of the 20th Century. It is an age of exploration and daring. An age of discovery, peril and mad science. It is the age of Pulp Fantastic!

Pulp Fantastic is a fast-paced game of action and adventure, where stalwart heroes face down dastardly villains, weird menaces and bizarre monstrosities in the name of all that is right and true!

Powered by the Vortex System (Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space and Primeval), Pulp Fantastic contains everything you need to create your own high-octane pulp adventures featuring masked avengers, mad scientists, gritty gumshoes or any other kind of pulp hero you can imagine. Included are a gazetteer and timeline of the Pulp Era, rules for creating vile villains and strange inventions, and a bestiary of monstrous creatures!

Adventure calls! Will you answer?

159587.description:
Contrées is a two player abstract game based on the mechanism of majority and surrounding.

Short resume of the rules:
The board is modular, it is made of specific hexagonal territories.
On that board each player plays his pawns on the corner of the hexagons and try to control as much territories as possible.
When a player have 4 pawn around a territory, he can place a possession mark on it and remove the enemy pawns from it.
It is pretty simple but be careful, like in the game of GO, you can surround the opponent pawns and capture them.
When both player have played all their pawns, the one who control the most territories wins.
159587.name: Contrées

159588.name: Sticks, Stones and Dragonflame
159588.description:
Sticks, Stones and Dragonflame is a 2P micro-game in which each player attempts to destroy the castle of their sworn enemy. Castles are formed by 6 cards or locations, numbered 1 to 6.

Every turn, players secretly roll a die and assault the matching location of their opponent's castle. However, players are allowed (and encouraged) to lie about their die result. The consequences of getting caught are dire, but getting away with the lie will bring victory much more swiftly. In addition, players have the option to manipulate luck by employing the services of powerful reinforcements.

Whenever a location is destroyed, the card is flipped and can't be used or assaulted again. Once the Heart of the Castle is destroyed, the owner of the castle loses the game and their opponent is declared the winner!

159589.name: Rivers and Streams
159589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rivers and Streams' is the third set of color battle tiles by The Forge Studios. It comprises 24 full color tiles suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map. Furthermore - the product contains 24 black & white Tactical Map sheets designed for DM to write in modifiers for cover, movement, etc. All tiles are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

'Rivers and Streams' is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign. However it works best with 'Strongholds 1: Manor' and 'Medieval Landscapes'.

The set includes:

24 5"x 8" color battle tiles.
24 Tactical Map sheets with pre-generated modifiers.
24 Tactical Map sheets with blank space left for DM to write in modifiers.

159590.name: Roads and Paths
159590.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Roads and Paths' is the first set of color battle tiles by The Forge Studios. It comprises 24 full color country roads and paths suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map. Furthermore - the product contains 24 black & white Tactical Map sheets designed for DM to write in modifiers for cover, movement, etc. All tiles are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

'Roads and Paths' is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign. However it works best with 'Strongholds 1: Manor' and 'Medieval Landscapes'.

The set includes:

24 5"x 8" color battle tiles.
24 Tactical Map sheets with pre-generated modifiers.
24 Tactical Map sheets with blank space left for DM to write in modifiers.

159591.name: Old Cemetery
159591.description:
From publisher blurb:

Old Cemetery comprises 24 full tiles suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map. Furthermore, the product contains 24 black & white Tactical Map sheets designed for DM to write in modifiers for cover, movement, etc. All tiles are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

Old Cemetery is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign or dungeon.

24 5"x 8" color battle tiles.
24 Tactical Map sheets with pre-generated modifiers.
4 bonus tiles featuring a staircase leading to CRYPT OF THE DAMNED

159592.name: Tomb of the Damned
159592.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tomb of the Damned comprises 24 full color chambers and corridors suitable for role-playing and miniature games. Each map tile is scaled to 1inch, and is designed to fit with other tiles to create complex battle map. Furthermore ? the product contains 24 black & white Tactical Map sheets designed for DM to write in modifiers for cover, movement, etc. All tiles are easy to print, cut, and can be presented to other players during a session, in order to enrich the description and create a more precise presentation.

Tomb of the Damned is a versatile supplement, replete with visual aids, which can be easily added to any campaign or dungeon.

24 5"x 8" color battle tiles.
24 Tactical Map sheets with pre-generated modifiers.

159593.name: Tomb of Delekin the Fallen
159593.description:
From publisher blurb:

Half a century ago the legendary mage Delekin reached his zenith but began a fall of monumental disaster. After being betrayed by his party the mage changed alignment and began a cruel tirade against the residents. He was finally taken down by the Lords of Evil and imprisoned in a tomb created to lure good adventurers to their death. Many have entered the unholy locale and none have returned. Whatever evil is present in the tomb is powerful, and most likely very wealthy. This adventure is one of the Original series i.e. an early work!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a higher level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159594.name: Grad Wars
159594.description:
In Grad Wars all players are students in different Universities. Their aim is to get their degree before everyone else does by passing 20 lessons first. They do this either by studying hard, or by visiting the other players in their classroom and harassing them.

Players can pass up to 5 lessons in every turn. They get their grade by rolling a 10-sided die for every lesson and then modifying the die with cards thrown by themselves or other players.

Cards can be adding or subtracting from a grade, and they can be special cards. But basically they describe student life as it is, or rather as we think it is. Players drink tons of coffee, they get shut in in bunkers to study focused, and they give exams using a Divine Pen. They also invade other players’ homes to sabotage their alarm clock, and they cause a Zombie Apocalypse inside other players’ classrooms. And they start crying in front of professors to get a passing grade, they cheat like there is no tomorrow, and they go to parties that cause year-long hangovers. Grad Wars is a game for the students who want to get their degree first no matter what the cost, or the means.

Στο παιχνίδι αυτό ο παίχτης είναι φοιτητές σε διαφορετικές σχολές. Σκοπός του παιχνιδιού είναι να πάρει πτυχίο πριν από τους υπόλοιπους, συμπληρώνοντας 20 περασμένα μαθήματα. Αυτό γίνεται είτε με το να κάτσει να διαβάσει, ή με το να πηγαίνει στη σχολή του άλλου και να τον παρενοχλεί. Σε κάθε γύρο μπορεί να δώσει μέχρι 5 μαθήματα, και οι γύροι συνεχίζονται μέχρι να βγει κάποιος νικητής.

Οι κάρτες περιγράφουν τη φοιτητική ζωή έτσι όπως είναι, ή μάλλον έτσι όπως πιστεύουμε ότι είναι. Ο παίχτης πίνει τόνους καφέ, κλείνεται σε πυρηνικά καταφύγια για να διαβάσει πιο συγκεντρωμένος, γράφει εξετάσεις με το Στυλό των Θεών. Μπαίνει στο σπίτι του άλλου και του σαμποτάρει το ξυπνητήρι, κλείνει γρίπη σε ένα βαζάκι και το βάζει κάτω από μύτες, στέλνει Ζόμπι Συμφοιτητές στο αμφιθέατρο των συμπαικτών του. Κλαίγεται στους καθηγητές για να περάσει, αντιγράφει μέχρι τελικής πτώσης, πηγαίνει σε πάρτι που το χανγκόβερ κρατάει ένα χρόνο. Ο Πτυχιούχος είναι το παιχνίδι του Φυτού, του φοιτητή που πρέπει να πάρει πτυχίο πρώτος με καθε μέσο.

159595.name: Kamienie Erenthi: Lasy Aranheim
159595.description: Each of the participants of the game becomes one of the heroes of the Erenthi world, wandering around the vast lands on their own or with their allies in search of magical stones. The task of the player involves getting the treasure or thwart the other participants' plans. An important element of the game is defining an ally and an enemy, owing to how easier it is to win and eliminate the competition. Each round ends by dealing the award cards and establishing the wounds incurred during the round. The player who has gained the most stones wins.

159596.name: Valiant Universe RPG QSR Supplemental: Harbinger Wars: Bloodshot
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
2015 ENnie for Best Free Product - Nominee
159596.description:
From the publishers website:
DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

No matter the powers, no matter the choices, the price in body and mind may be more than you’re willing to pay. And your choices will lead to heroics…or to villainy. How will you be remembered?

The edge between superhero and villain has never been sharper. In the Valiant Universe RPG, players will immerse themselves in a dark and gritty world where every mission and every battle has deadly consequences. Whether playing X-O Manowar, Bloodshot, Shadowman or even the all-powerful Toyo Harada—or any of dozens of characters—Valiant’s most fearless heroes will unite for the first time in a roleplaying game, allowing you to join their stories and create new ones!

Whether you’re a longtime fan or brand new to the Valiant Universe, this is the only source you’ll need to bring Valiant’s leading characters to life in a fantastic superheroes setting!

Are you ready to take the reins of one of the most dangerous forces in the Valiant Universe? In Harbinger Wars: Bloodshot Supplemental, leave no foe standing as Bloodshot and his psiot companions blast their way to freedom through soldiers, cyborgs, and other dangers.

This PDF-exclusive includes Dossiers for Bloodshot and the young psiots Cloud, Headspace, and Titan. Also, four all-new Harbinger Wars Event briefs offer a new perspective into this deadly conflict.

159597.name: Mythic Efreeti
159597.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lords of Fire and Magic!

There can be no doubt that the efreeti are a powerful and fearsome race. They rule the Elemental Plane of Fire with a red-hot, molten iron fist. Their capital, the fabled City of Brass, is known throughout the multiverse as a great center of learning, culture, trade, and much more. Even the least among them is skilled in magic, by mortal standards, and their race was ancient when man and elf first came into being. They are also a proud race, and chafe at the thought of being forced to serve lesser beings, but the threat of fiery vengeance does little to dissuade the numerous spellcasters who nonetheless take it upon themselves to summon and bind efreet for their own mysterious purposes. It is rumored among these circles that there are some efreet who rival—or even exceed—the greatest efreeti nobles in power, and these are the mythic efreeti.

This book presents game statistics for a mythic efreeti, which has several unique abilities never seen elsewhere. A mythic efreeti can breathe clouds of thick black smoke on a whim to blind and disable their foes. They can also burn with much greater intensity than their lesser kin, and their ability to change the size of other creatures is enhanced as well. Perhaps their most notorious power is their ability to bind foes with golden shackles that impair their ability to fight, and also their ability to resist the mythic efreeti’s power. Finally, in addition to the mythic efreeti itself, the book contains rules for performing special rituals that can be enacted by characters of any class in order to summon a mythic efreeti, as well as two such rituals: the flame warrior’s calling, and the invocation of the chained sultan.

159598.name: Kaiju Patrol Zero
159598.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kaiju Patrol Zero is the revised version of Kaiju Patrol, the original, systemless Official Series Bible setting where you battle Giant Monsters and Evil Aliens with science!

Kaiju Patrol is currently being expanded into a complete game, powered by Fate!

159599.name: Twin Furies
159599.description:
From publisher blurb:

The religion of the dark god Khayne is divided and scattered, with each small cult worshiping their bloody lord after their own malicious fashion. One of the largest cults in the Brotherhood of Khayne—as well as the most ruthless and organized—is the Untharan Brotherhood, a monastic order in which adherents practice draconian discipline, ritual bloodletting, and the art of war. While they spend much of their efforts aiding the rest of the Brotherhood in fending off the quickslavers, members of this order have occasionally clashed with the forces running the Imperial blockade of the islands of Unthara, wielding weapons of terrifying power. Among these weapons are the Twin Furies, a matched pair of kamas that focus the hatred of Khayne into a fierce presence upon the battlefield.

159600.name: X-plorers Quick Start Rules
159600.description:
From publisher blurb:

CALLING ALL X-PLORERS:

The Universe is a big place with big problems - that's where you come in!

Put on your space suit, charge your ray gun, and flip ignition on an outer-space adventure!

This Quick Start introduction to X-plorers explains the basic rules and includes six pregenerated characters so you can begin playing the included adventure immediately!

In X-plorers, you're part of a group of galactic troubleshooters on the look out for the next job - whether it be salvage, search, or rescue on an alien world.

Players: Explore, defend, and save the galaxy!

Be a SCIENTIST: Unravel the mysteries of a new alien race!
Be a SOLDIER: Take aim and defend against enemy invaders!
Be a TECHNICIAN: Pilot a spaceship through imminent danger!
Be a SCOUT: Foil the overlord's plans using espionage!

159601.name: Yarr! Rules Light Pirate RPG
159601.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rules Light Pirate ArrrPG for children, beginners and veteran players alike!

Avast, me hearties! Join me, fer adventure 'n' treasure huntin' on t' high seas! Become the infamous pirates ye deserve ta be an’ feed yer hunger fer glory an’ riches! YARR!

YARR! is a fun, easy to learn game for kids, beginners or veteran players who emphasize story and role play over rules. YARR! is intuitive for anyone who has played any OGL / d20 game. It is streamlined so that kids can grasp it easily but robust enough (and including advanced rules for skills) so that veteran player won't find it overly simplified.

Yarr! includes rules for ship to ship combat, a bestiary of human and monstrous adversaries, booty (treasure) appropriate for historical fantasy of the Golden Age of Piracy, Mermaid magic, even a Pirate Talk glossary!

Yarr!

159602.name: The Baron's Gold
159602.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sandbox adventure for three or more pirates of any level! Usable with other games and replayable since there are so many options for how the story may turn out!

When cap’n “Toothless Ted” Jones finally finds the map leading to the legendary mother lode of Baron Gottfried von Heinzelmann, mutiny breaks out and the cap’n is marooned. But somehow, he snuck the map off the ship! Now, every pirate in port is scrambling to be the first to rescue (or at least find) Toothless Ted, recover the map, and claim the largest treasure ever buried!

Writen for Yarr! Pirate RPG but easily used in any OGL game or converted to d20 or Castles & Crusades, or others.

159603.name: Booklet o' Booty
159603.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avast! More Extraordinary Booty fer yer gold huntin' adventures on the high seas, me hearties! Yarr!

Degined for the YARR! Pirate RPG, and compatible with Dagger RPG for kids, and all or most OGL / OSR / d20 games.

159604.name: Encounters
159604.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avast! Encounter Tables t' help yer Referee fill out or create an adventure on t' high seas, or the islands ye dig up treasure on, or anywhere else yer band o' pirates may go.

Degined for the YARR! Pirate RPG, and compatible with all or most OGL / OSR / d20 games.

159605.name: Avast, Thar Be Ninjas!
159605.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avast! Here be a suppl'ment for Yarr! Pirate RPG!

Everyone knows Pirates and Ninjas have always been mortal enemies (like, duh). Now, for the first time, you can enjoy the added realism and opportunities for historically accurate role-play by adding ninjas to your pirate adventures on the high seas.

While Avast! Thar be Ninjas! has a fun, goofy tone (an April Fools day confection), it can be taken seriously with three new classes, new spells, and new rules for poisons.
