Deadzone The Podcast 24.0 - Zombies!!!
Deadzone The Podcast 25.0 - Community Pat!
Deadzone The Podcast 25.5 - Enter the Deadzone 1
Deadzone The Podcast 26.0 - Mantic Open Day

159723.name: Walters Verjaardagsshow Spel
159723.description:
Walters Verjaardagsshow Spel is based on a popular television show on Belgian television channel VTM that aired in 1989.

Players compete against each other in several rounds to gather different colors of keys.

After six rounds all players go to the vault, the gamemaster throws a colored die into the vault and then after lifting it, the player who has the key that matches the die face it has landed on, wins the game.

159725.name: Diehard Dungeon
159725.description:
Combining its own unique take on the real-time roguelike genre, with a nostalgic 16-bit look and feel; Diehard Dungeon is a game that feels both familiar and quite different at the same time, occupying a curious middle ground between The Legend of Zelda and The Binding of Isaac. [Edge online 2012]

Followed by a trusty, treasure collecting companion chest, the player must make their way through the dungeons many randomly-generated rooms and levels. Armed with a sword and a ‘hand cannon’, all manner of nasty dungeon dwellers, bosses and traps will need to be defeated or traversed in order to emerge from the dungeon victorious!

To aid them in their quest, the player may be lucky enough to encounter one or more upgrades, or new abilities, scattered throughout the dungeon.

A randomly generated dungeon is created every playthrough.

Discover the dungeons many secrets and multiple outcomes.

Source: The Game Website.

159726.name: Armatech Arms Catalog Spring 2223
159726.description:
From publisher blurb:

Armatech is proud to present the newest line of offerings available to UCN X-plorers for sale in early 2223.
Ask about bulk discounting and field-testing opportunities!

Armatech, Your HQ for Tactical Armaments

A licensed equipment supplement / sourcebook for the X-plorers RPG.

Add new weapons and defenses to your game of X-plorers, including the Heat Ray, Sonic shield, and ATACS targeting computer.

Easily adaptable to any d20 game.

159727.name: Nepal Temple Square
159727.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 40 x 40 inch Battlemap of a Nepal Temple Square, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“The night of the sacred festival is a time of joyous celebration. How dare you profane this square on such a holy night!”

Based on the ancient cities of Kathmandu and Patan in the Himalayan republic of Nepal, South Asia. Explore inside the old temple or haggle for goods in the marketplace, take a ride in a rickshaw or visit the Hindu and Buddhist shrines.

Nepal Temple Square is intended for use in fantasy or modern games. The dislodged slabs of stone may indicate that the area could have been recently abandoned for a horror-themed game as well.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Holy Festival: Every year a festival is held at the Temple Square at night. Fireworks light up the night sky as the people celebrate. The market puts up a temporary stall in front, which sells snacks and drinks all night long. The people rejoice and enjoy themselves until a sudden hailstorm appears. The people run for cover from the large hailstones. An icy, pale silhouette appears and begins attacking the temple monks.

The player characters could be here at the festival enjoying themselves when these events occur. The player characters can help protect the monks by defeating the mysterious assailant attempting to interrupt the festival. Alternatively, the player characters could join the villain in attacking the monks, attempting to learn the figure’s true plan or even join them.

159728.name: Decibelle
159728.description:
From publisher blurb:

DECIBELLE!

Hero. Agent. Icon. Decibelle is a sonic superstar that fights as a costumed hero and as operative of A.C.T.I.O.N. A founding member of The Homeguard, she now works in their Reserve while continuing her adventures.

159729.name: Eets Munchies
videogamehonor: 2014 CVA Best iOS Game of the Year Nominee
2014 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
159729.description:
User summary
Eets Munchies is a puzzle game developed by Klei Entertainment. Players have to help an hungry creature devour cake in increasingly devious puzzles. To accomplish that, players will be able to plan and place objects and food on the creature's way, changing it's behavior or giving him special abilities.

159730.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 101 (up and down the Eiffel Tower)
- moving by turns -
Roll the die and move forward; ending on a red marked space follow instructíons.

Note:
Game was published first in 1889 (inauguration); moderate changes (see images) within a reprint; mentioned artist: L. Robert
159730.name: Grand Jeu de la Tour Eiffel

159731.name: Numenera Character Options
159731.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Character Your Envision

Every player wants to play exactly the character they envision. And Numenera Character Options is here to help make that possible! This book is brimming with new material and new choices to help make Numenera character creation even more fun, more interesting, and more weird.

Numenera Character Options includes:

More than 40 new abilities for each character type. New fighting moves for glaives, esoteries for nanos, and tricks of the trade for jacks.
More than 40 new descriptors, including location-based descriptors to tie your character to the setting of the Ninth World, and even “negative” descriptors like Craven, Cruel, and Doomed.
Dozens of new foci, such as Battles Automatons, Masters Insects, Moves Like a Cat, Never Says Die, and Travels Through Time.
New mutations for mutant characters.
Four new racial descriptors (including a new visitant type) for players who really want to play something weird.
New options for advancement beyond the sixth tier.
Much more!

159732.name: Gravity Badgers
159732.description:
Step into the space suit of a valiant space badger as he ventures into the deadly depths of deep space to save his friends, family and the universe itself from the threat of the deadly Evil Honey Badgers aka the Hellsett. For the first time EVER a game unites the thrilling elements of Badgers and Gravity to create a stunningly presented physics based puzzle game that will take you beyond the realms of possibility, imagination and logic to the star dusted realm of the GRAVITY BADGERS!

Throw yourself into the unfeeling grasp of planets, dodge asteroids and fight unyielding and deadly bosses in over a hundred levels of vacuum filled adventure and danger, all united under a stunning art style reminiscent of all your favourite 80's cartoons complete with a thumping mullet rock sound track!

Source: The Publisher Website.

159733.name: Guncraft
159733.description:
Guncraft is a voxel-based first person shooter that boasts fully destructible environments, the ability to construct individual blocks or full structures in a single click, tons of killstreak rewards such as helicopters, jetpacks, bunker buster missiles, drones, and turrets, and a fully featured map creation tool that also features a voxel map importing function (using the Substrate C# engine). Play traditional modes like Deathmatch and CTF, or totally unique modes like Lava Survival and Siege Mode. On top of that, there are standalone servers, peer hosted servers, clan support and friends lists, in and out of game chat, leaderboards, and much, much more.

Source: The Developer Website.

159734.name: The Garden Mage
159734.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modern Advances: The Garden Mage is one in a series of small supplements from veteran game designer Steve Miller that present quirky advanced classes and other material for use in OGL Modern games.

Featured in this release are:

The Garden Mage advanced class.
Six garden mage spells, including Kyle's Marvelous Mower and Perfect Lawn.
Five new magic items that no well-equipped garden mage will want to be without.
A fully detailed NPC - world-famous garden mage Kyle Bellamy.

159735.name: Fugitive
159735.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I didn't do it! When I find the one-eyed nun, you'll know I'm innocent!"

Whether wanted for a murder he didn't commit, or if he saw something he shouldn't have, or if he crossed the wrong people one too many times, the character is on the run. He needs to keep his freedom at least long enough to make sure he keeps his life!

Modern Advances: Fugitive is an advanced class for characters on the run from powerful organizations or individuals, because they want to prove their innocence or because they crossed the wrong person. Inspired by films and TV shows like Enemy of the State, Nowhere Man, and, of course, The Fugitive, this eight-page booklet includes:

The Fugitive advanced class.
Three new feats--False ID, Conceal Item, and Flickering Shadow.
A fully detailed NPC -- Fugitive Hal Hollander.




Modern Advances: The Fugitive continues NUELOW's series of quirky releases for the Modern OGL RPG system. Each entry in the series features an advanced class, an NPC, and a selection of rules that are ready to be dropped into your game whether you can find immediate use for the class and character or not.

159736.description:
Two most important battles of the Thaddeus Kościuszko Insurection. Racławice, although they were just tactical victory, become symbol of brave and solidarity between social classes, because of the decisive role of scythes using militia knowns as "Kosynierzy" (Scythe-armed). Battle of Maciejowice was the last battle of Thaddeus Kościuszko Insurection. Polish forces, outnumbered by Russians, lost the battle.

Game was published in 38 issue of magazine "Taktyka i strategia". It uses "Napoleon" system rules.

Each battle has two scenarios:
- Racławice (for Racławice)
- Kosynierzy (for Racławice)
- Maciejowice (for Maciejowice)
- Wzgórze (for Maciejowice)
159736.name: Racławice/Maciejowice 1794

159737.description:
Space Frontier is a game of space exploration for 2-4 players. Players compete to spread their influence across a region of uncharted space. The game takes roughly an hour to an hour and a half to play with 2 players with each additional player adding about a half hour.

Each player controls a command ship and its supporting fleets. The command ship is a mobile factory, research lab, and ship carrier. Players will use it to construct the fleets that help spread their influence far and wide.

The modular space map is built from randomized tiles each game as players explore. The random map generation ensures no two games of Space Frontier are exactly the same.

Players gain influence through missions, research, trade, or conquest. Players can be as cooperative or antagonistic with each other as they wish. Thus, games can be played and won where military might reigns supreme, or without a shot being fired.
159737.name: Space Frontier

159738.name: Grim Portents (Issue 2 - May 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Morgan City, Louisiana: A Monster of the Week Mystery
159738.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second issue of the Dungeon World/Powered by the Apocalypse fan e-zine Grim Portents is available for download here! Explore the Wine-Dark Sea, face off against a hydrodaemon, establish your own tavern and generate a secret spy organisation.

159739.name: Spielwelt (Issue 21 - Oct 1984)
rpgpublisher: Club für Fantasy- und Simulationsspiele e.V.
159739.description: The first issue under the name of Spielwelt (continuing the numbering after #20 of Mythos) contains detailed reviews of the German D&D basic set and the first DSA Abenteuer-Basis-Spiel, a review of the wargame Bloodtree Rebellion, tabletop rules named Schlachtruf (credited to Ral Partha), and the tolkienesque Midgard scenario Tumunzahar: Die Zwergenbinge. Advice for painting miniatures and hobby news round the issue off.

159740.name: Monster Monpiece
159740.description:
Monster Monpiece is a card battle video game. The game re-imagines mythological creatures and monsters, such as unicorns and minotaurs, as girls and women created by more than 50 different artists. The game allows multiplayer card battles online for 2 players. The game is based around battling with four types of cards, not all of which are monsters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Monster Monpiece," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

159741.name: Spielwelt (Issue 22 - Jan 1985)
rpgpublisher: Club für Fantasy- und Simulationsspiele e.V.
159741.description: This issue contains news, reviews, articles on solo gamebooks, historical articles (Rome vs. Carthago; Assyria), miniatures info, and a fantasy scenario with stats for the major RPGs of the time.

159742.name: Moero Chronicle
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Gal of the Year Nominee
159742.description:
The player plays as Io, an ordinary boy with a tender heart, whom village elders force to "go on a journey" to save the world from disaster. Io, although ambitious, is scared to talk to girls in fear of them labeling him as a pervert. Crises are occurring all over the world at the beginning of the game, and "monster girls", which inhabit it, have suddenly become hostile to humans, with a "legendary monster girl" thought to be the cause.

Source: Wikipedia, "Moero Chronicle," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

159743.name: Fast Bucks
159743.description:
The game has 2 decks of cards: Fast Buck Cards (FB) and Market Value Cards (MV). Each player is dealt 7 FB cards, and a FB card is dealt face down in the middle of the table. This is the bonus card.

Players may draw 1 FB card per turn from the deck or the discard pile. They then check their FB cards for 3 of a kind and place them face down on the table. The player then draws a MV card, and follows what it says. It can either affect your hand's value or have you draw another FB or MV card.

When a player has no more FB cards in hand, that player gets a $150,000 bonus and the bonus card is revealed. If a player has a card that matches the bonus in hand, that player receives a $250,000 bonus. The other cards on the table are then scored. Play continues until someone reaches $1,000,000.
